sentences.zh: 兵至滑，鄭販賣賈人弦高，持十二牛將賣之周，見秦兵，恐死虜，因獻其牛，曰：「聞大國將誅鄭，鄭君謹修守御備，使臣以牛十二勞軍士。」

translations.literal: Troops reached Hua, Zheng merchant trader Xian Gao, holding twelve oxen will sell to Zhou, saw Qin troops, feared death capture, therefore offered his oxen, said: 'Heard great state will punish Zheng, Zheng ruler carefully repaired defense preparations, made minister with twelve oxen reward army soldiers.'
translations.idiomatic: The troops reached Hua. Xian Gao, a Zheng merchant and trader, was holding twelve oxen that he was about to sell in Zhou. He saw the Qin troops, feared death or capture, and therefore offered his oxen, saying, 'I have heard that the great state will punish Zheng. The Zheng ruler has carefully prepared his defenses. He sent me with these twelve oxen to reward the army soldiers.'

sentences.zh: 秦三將軍相謂曰：「將襲鄭，鄭今已覺之，往無及已。」

translations.literal: Qin three generals mutually told said: 'Will raid Zheng, Zheng now already aware, go no reach already.'
translations.idiomatic: The three Qin generals said to each other, 'We were going to raid Zheng, but Zheng is now already aware. Going there will be of no use.'

sentences.zh: 滅滑。

translations.literal: They extinguished Hua.

sentences.zh: 滑，晉之邊邑也。

translations.literal: Hua was a border city of Jin.

A Zheng person sold Zheng to Qin saying: 'I control its city gate. Zheng can be raided.' Mu Gong asked Jianshu and Baili Xi. They replied: 'Going through several states for a thousand li to raid someone - rarely do such ventures obtain benefit. Moreover, someone is selling Zheng. How do we know our own people haven't informed Zheng of our plans? Cannot.' Mu Gong said: 'You don't understand. I have already decided.' He then sent troops, having Baili Xi's son Meng Mingshi, Jianshu's son Xi Qishu, and Bai Yibing lead the troops. On the day of departure, Baili Xi and Jianshu wept for them. Mu Gong heard and angrily said: 'I am sending troops and you obstruct and weep for my army. Why?' The two elders said: 'We do not dare obstruct your army. When the army goes, our sons go with it; We are old and fear we will not see each other again if they return late, so we weep.' The two elders withdrew and told their sons: 'Your army will be defeated, and it will be at the Xiao defile.' In spring of the thirty-third year, the Qin troops went east, passing through Jin territory and the north gate of Zhou. Zhou's royal grandson Man said: 'The Qin army has no ritual. What are they waiting for if not defeat!' The troops reached Hua. The Zheng merchant Xian Gao, holding twelve oxen to sell to Zhou, saw the Qin troops. Fearing death or capture, he offered his oxen and said: 'I have heard the great state will punish Zheng. The Zheng ruler has carefully prepared defenses. He sent me with twelve oxen to reward the army soldiers.' The three Qin generals told each other: 'We were going to raid Zheng, but Zheng is already aware. Going now would be pointless.' They extinguished Hua. Hua was a border city of Jin.

sentences.zh: 當是時，晉文公喪尚未葬。

translations.literal: At this time, Duke Wen of Jin's funeral had not yet been held.

sentences.zh: 太子襄公怒曰：「秦侮我孤，因喪破我滑。」

translations.literal: Crown prince Xiang Gong angry said: 'Qin insults my orphan, because mourning broke my Hua.'
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Xiang Gong angrily said, 'Qin insults my orphaned state, and because of mourning they broke my Hua.'

sentences.zh: 遂墨衰绖，發兵遮秦兵於殽，擊之，大破秦軍，無一人得脫者。

translations.literal: He then donned black mourning garments with hemp cords and sent troops to block the Qin army at Xiao, striking them and greatly defeating the Qin army, with not a single person escaping.

sentences.zh: 虜秦三將以歸。

translations.literal: They captured the three Qin generals and returned.

sentences.zh: 文公夫人，秦女也，為秦三囚將請曰：「繆公之怨此三人入於骨髓，願令此三人歸，令我君得自快烹之。」

translations.literal: Wen Gong lady, Qin woman, for Qin three prisoner generals requested said: 'Mu Gong resentment these three people entered into bone marrow, wish make these three people return, make my ruler get personally satisfy boil them.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen's lady, who was a Qin woman, pleaded for the three captive Qin generals, saying, 'Duke Mu's resentment toward these three has entered his very bone marrow. I wish to have these three returned so that my ruler may personally satisfy himself by boiling them.'

sentences.zh: 晉君許之，歸秦三將。

translations.literal: The Jin ruler permitted it and returned the three Qin generals.

sentences.zh: 三將至，繆公素服郊迎，向三人哭曰：「孤以不用百里傒、蹇叔言以辱三子，三子何罪乎？

translations.literal: Three generals arrived, Mu Gong plain clothes suburban welcomed, facing three people cried said: 'I because not used Bai Li Xi, Jian Shu words with humiliated three sons, three sons what crime?
translations.idiomatic: When the three generals arrived, Duke Mu in plain clothes went out to the suburbs to welcome them, and facing the three men he wept, saying, 'I humiliated you three sons because I did not use the words of Baili Xi and Jian Shu—what crime have you three committed?'

sentences.zh: 子其悉心雪恥，毋怠。」

translations.literal: You completely heart wash shame, no lax.'
translations.idiomatic: You must completely devote your hearts to washing away this shame—do not be lax.'

sentences.zh: 遂復三人官秩如故，愈益厚之。

translations.literal: He then restored the three men's official ranks as before and treated them increasingly generously.

At this time, Duke Wen of Jin's funeral had not yet taken place. Crown Prince Xiang Gong angrily said: 'Qin insults my orphaned state and broke my Hua during mourning.' He then donned black mourning garments with hemp cords and sent troops to block the Qin army at Xiao. They struck them and greatly defeated the Qin army. Not one person escaped. They captured the three Qin generals and returned. Duke Wen's lady, who was a Qin woman, pleaded for the three captive Qin generals: 'Mu Gong's resentment of these three has entered his bone marrow. I wish to have these three returned so my ruler can personally satisfy himself by boiling them.' The Jin ruler permitted it and returned the three Qin generals. When the three generals arrived, Mu Gong in plain clothes welcomed them in the suburbs. Facing the three, he wept and said: 'Because I did not use the words of Baili Xi and Jianshu, I have humiliated you three. What crime have you three committed? You must devote yourselves completely to washing away this shame. Do not be lax.' He then restored their official ranks as before and treated them even more generously.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，楚太子商臣弒其父成王代立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, Chu's Crown Prince Shang Chen assassinated his father King Cheng and replaced him on the throne.
In the thirty-fourth year, Chu's crown prince Shang Chen assassinated his father King Cheng and replaced him.

sentences.zh: 繆公於是復使孟明視等將兵伐晉，戰于彭衙。

translations.literal: Duke Mu thus again had Meng Ming Shi and the others lead troops to attack Jin, fighting at Pengya.

sentences.zh: 秦不利，引兵歸。

translations.literal: Qin was unfavorable, so they led their troops back.
Mu Gong thus again had Meng Mingshi and others lead troops to attack Jin. They fought at Pengya. Qin was unfavorable and led their troops back.

sentences.zh: 戎王使由余於秦。

translations.literal: The Rong king sent You Yu to Qin.

sentences.zh: 由余，其先晉人也，亡入戎，能晉言。

translations.literal: You Yu's ancestors were Jin people. He fled and entered the Rong, and could speak Jin language.

sentences.zh: 聞繆公賢，故使由余觀秦。

translations.literal: He had heard that Duke Mu was worthy, so he sent You Yu to observe Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公示以宮室、積聚。

translations.literal: Duke Mu of Qin showed him the palaces and accumulations.

sentences.zh: 由余曰：「使鬼為之，則勞神矣。

translations.literal: You Yu said: 'Make ghosts do it, then labor spirits.'
translations.idiomatic: You Yu said, 'If ghosts did this, it would labor the spirits.'

sentences.zh: 使人為之，亦苦民矣。」

translations.literal: Make people do it, also bitter people.'
translations.idiomatic: If people did this, it would also embitter the people.'

sentences.zh: 繆公怪之，問曰：「中國以詩書禮樂法度為政，然尚時亂，今戎夷無此，何以為治，不亦難乎？」

translations.literal: Mu Gong astonished it, asked said: 'China with poetry books ritual music laws as government, yet still sometimes chaos, now Rong Yi without this, what with govern, not also difficult?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu was astonished by this and asked, 'China uses poetry, books, ritual, music, and laws as government, yet it still sometimes falls into chaos. Now the Rong and Yi have none of this—what do they govern with? Is it not difficult?'

sentences.zh: 由余笑曰：「此乃中國所以亂也。

translations.literal: You Yu laughed said: 'This namely China so chaos.
translations.idiomatic: You Yu laughed and said, 'This is precisely why China falls into chaos.'

sentences.zh: 夫自上聖黃帝作為禮樂法度，身以先之，僅以小治。

translations.literal: Since the supreme sage, the Yellow Emperor, made ritual, music, and laws, and led them with his own person, he barely achieved small governance.

sentences.zh: 及其後世，日以驕淫。

translations.literal: When it reached his later generations, they became increasingly arrogant and licentious.

sentences.zh: 阻法度之威，以責督於下，下罷極則以仁義怨望於上，上下交爭怨而相篡弒，至於滅宗，皆以此類也。

translations.literal: They block the majesty of laws and use them to demand and supervise those below. When those below are extremely exhausted, they resent and blame those above with benevolence and righteousness. Above and below contend with resentment and mutually usurp and kill, until clans are extinguished—all of this category.

sentences.zh: 夫戎夷不然。

translations.literal: The Rong and Yi are not like this.

sentences.zh: 上含淳德以遇其下，下懷忠信以事其上，一國之政猶一身之治，不知所以治，此真聖人之治也。」

translations.literal: Above contain pure virtue with meet their below, below cherish loyal faith with serve their above, one state government like one body govern, not know so govern, this true sage person govern also.'
translations.idiomatic: Those above contain pure virtue to meet those below, those below cherish loyalty and faith to serve those above. A state's government is like governing one body—not knowing how it is governed, this is truly the governance of sage persons.'

sentences.zh: 於是繆公退而問內史廖曰：「孤聞鄰國有聖人，敵國之憂也。

translations.literal: Thus Mu Gong withdrew asked inner scribe Liao said: 'I heard neighboring state has sage person, enemy state worry also.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Duke Mu withdrew and asked the inner scribe Liao, 'I have heard that when a neighboring state has a sage person, it is the worry of enemy states.'

sentences.zh: 今由余賢，寡人之害，將奈之何？」

translations.literal: Now You Yu worthy, my harm, will how?'
translations.idiomatic: Now You Yu is worthy—this is my harm. What shall I do about it?'

sentences.zh: 內史廖曰：「戎王處辟匿，未聞中國之聲。

translations.literal: Inner scribe Liao said: 'Rong king dwells remote hidden, not heard China sound.
translations.idiomatic: The inner scribe Liao said, 'The Rong king dwells in remote concealment and has not heard China's sounds.'

sentences.zh: 君試遺其女樂，以奪其志；

translations.literal: Ruler try send his female music, with seize his will;
translations.idiomatic: Your lordship should try sending him female musicians to seize his will;

sentences.zh: 為由余請，以疏其閒；

translations.literal: For You Yu request, with loosen their between;
translations.idiomatic: make requests for You Yu to loosen the space between them;

sentences.zh: 留而莫遣，以失其期。

translations.literal: detain him and do not send him back, to lose their timing.

sentences.zh: 戎王怪之，必疑由余。

translations.literal: The Rong king will find it strange and must suspect You Yu.'

sentences.zh: 君臣有閒，乃可虜也。

translations.literal: When ruler and minister have space between them, then he can be captured.'

sentences.zh: 且戎王好樂，必怠於政。」

translations.literal: Moreover Rong king likes music, must neglect politics.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the Rong king likes music and must neglect his government.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said, 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 因與由余曲席而坐，傳器而食，問其地形與其兵勢盡察，而後令內史廖以女樂二八遺戎王。

translations.literal: He therefore sat with You Yu on curved mats, passed vessels and ate together, questioned him about his terrain and troop situation until he had examined everything, and then commanded the inner scribe Liao to send the Rong king sixteen female musicians.

sentences.zh: 戎王受而說之，終年不還。

translations.literal: The Rong king received them and was pleased, staying a whole year without returning.

sentences.zh: 於是秦乃歸由余。

translations.literal: Thus Qin returned You Yu.

sentences.zh: 由余數諫不聽，繆公又數使人閒要由余，由余遂去降秦。

translations.literal: You Yu admonished several times but was not listened to. Duke Mu again sent people several times to secretly intercept You Yu. You Yu then left and surrendered to Qin.

sentences.zh: 繆公以客禮禮之，問伐戎之形。

translations.literal: Duke Mu treated him with guest ritual and asked about the form of attacking the Rong.

The Rong king sent You Yu to Qin. You Yu's ancestors were Jin people. He fled and entered the Rong, and could speak the Jin language. Having heard Mu Gong was worthy, he therefore sent You Yu to observe Qin. Qin Mu Gong showed him the palaces and accumulations. You Yu said: 'If ghosts made it, then it would labor the spirits. If people made it, it would also embitter the people.' Mu Gong was astonished and asked: 'China uses poetry, books, ritual, music, and laws to govern, yet there is still occasional chaos. Now the Rong and Yi have none of this. What do they govern with? Is it not difficult?' You Yu laughed and said: 'This is precisely why China is chaotic. Since the supreme sage Yellow Emperor created ritual, music, and laws, and led by example himself, he barely achieved a small measure of order. When it came to his later generations, they became increasingly arrogant and licentious. They blocked the authority of the laws and used them to demand and supervise from below. When the lower people became utterly exhausted, they resented and hoped for benevolence and righteousness from above. Ruler and subject mutually contended and resented each other, leading to usurpation and assassination, even to the extinction of clans. All of this is of this category. The Rong and Yi are not like this. The superiors contain pure virtue in treating their inferiors. The inferiors cherish loyalty and faith in serving their superiors. A state's government is like governing one body. They don't know how they govern - this is truly the governance of sages.' Thus Mu Gong withdrew and asked Inner Scribe Liao: 'I have heard that neighboring states having sages is the worry of enemy states. Now You Yu is worthy. He is my harm. What shall I do?' Inner Scribe Liao said: 'The Rong king dwells in remote seclusion and has not heard the sounds of China. Your majesty should try sending him female musicians to seize his will; make requests for You Yu to loosen the space between them; detain him and not send him back, to make him miss his deadline. The Rong king will find it strange and must suspect You Yu. When there is space between ruler and minister, then we can capture him. Moreover, the Rong king likes music and must neglect his governance.' Mu Gong said: 'Good.' Therefore he sat with You Yu on curved mats and ate by passing vessels. He asked about the terrain and troop dispositions and examined everything. Then he commanded Inner Scribe Liao to send sixteen female musicians to the Rong king. The Rong king received them and was pleased. He did not return for a whole year. Thus Qin then returned You Yu. You Yu admonished several times but was not listened to. Mu Gong again several times had people secretly intercept You Yu. You Yu then left and surrendered to Qin. Mu Gong treated him with guest rituals and asked about the form of attacking the Rong.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，繆公復益厚孟明等，使將兵伐晉，渡河焚船，大敗晉人，取王官及鄗，以報殽之役。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Mu again increased his generosity toward Meng Ming and the others, had them lead troops to attack Jin, crossed the river and burned their boats, greatly defeated the Jin people, took Wangguan and Gao, to repay the Xiao campaign.

sentences.zh: 晉人皆城守不敢出。

translations.literal: The Jin people all walled themselves in and guarded, daring not to go out.

sentences.zh: 於是繆公乃自茅津渡河，封殽中尸，為發喪，哭之三日。

translations.literal: Thus Duke Mu then crossed the river from Maojin, buried the corpses in the Xiao defile, held mourning for them, and wept for three days.

sentences.zh: 乃誓於軍曰：「嗟士卒！

translations.literal: Then swore in army said: 'Alas soldiers!
translations.idiomatic: He then swore an oath in the army, saying, 'Alas, soldiers!'

sentences.zh: 聽無譁，余誓告汝。

translations.literal: Listen without making noise—I swear to tell you.

sentences.zh: 古之人謀黃髪番番，則無所過。」

translations.literal: Ancient people consulted white hair repeatedly, then nothing wrong.'
translations.idiomatic: The people of ancient times consulted repeatedly with the elders, and thus committed no wrongs.'

sentences.zh: 以申思不用蹇叔、百里傒之謀，故作此誓，令後世以記余過。

translations.literal: To declare my regret at not having used the plans of Jian Shu and Baili Xi, I therefore made this oath, so that later generations might record my mistake.

sentences.zh: 君子聞之，皆為垂涕，曰：「嗟乎！

translations.literal: Gentlemen heard it, all for shed tears, said: 'Alas!
translations.idiomatic: When gentlemen heard of it, they all shed tears for him, saying, 'Alas!'

sentences.zh: 秦繆公之與人周也，卒得孟明之慶。」

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong with people thorough also, finally got Meng Ming blessing.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin's thoroughness with people finally brought him Meng Ming's blessing.'

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Mu Gong again treated Meng Ming and the others even more generously. He had them lead troops to attack Jin. They crossed the river and burned their boats. They greatly defeated the Jin people, taking Wangguan and Gao, to repay the Xiao campaign. The Jin people all defended their cities and dared not come out. Thus Mu Gong then crossed the river from Maojin. He buried the corpses in Xiao and held mourning. He wept for them for three days. He then swore to the army saying: 'Alas, soldiers! Listen without noise. I swear and tell you. Ancient people consulted the white-haired elders repeatedly, then there was nothing wrong.' To declare my regret at not using the plans of Jianshu and Baili Xi, I therefore made this oath, so that later generations will record my mistake. The gentlemen who heard it all shed tears and said: 'Alas! Duke Mu of Qin was thorough with people. In the end he got Meng Ming's blessing.'

sentences.zh: 三十七年，秦用由余謀伐戎王，益國十二，開地千里，遂霸西戎。

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, Qin used You Yu's plan to attack the Rong king, increased their states by twelve, opened up a thousand li of land, and then became hegemon over the western Rong.

sentences.zh: 天子使召公過賀繆公以金鼓。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven had Duke Shao Guo congratulate Duke Mu with gold drums.

sentences.zh: 三十九年，繆公卒，葬雍。

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, Duke Mu died and was buried at Yong.

sentences.zh: 從死者百七十七人，秦之良臣子輿氏三人名曰奄息、仲行、鍼虎，亦在從死之中。

translations.literal: There were one hundred and seventy-seven followers in death. Three good ministers of Qin from the Ziyushi clan named Yanxi, Zhongxing, and Zhenhui were also among those who followed in death.

sentences.zh: 秦人哀之，為作歌黃鳥之詩。

translations.literal: The Qin people mourned them and made the poem 'Yellow Bird' for them.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「秦繆公廣地益國，東服彊晉，西霸戎夷，然不為諸侯盟主，亦宜哉。

translations.literal: Gentlemen said: 'Qin Mu Gong broadened land increased state, east subjugated strong Jin, west hegemoned Rong Yi, yet not became feudal lords alliance leader, also fitting.
translations.idiomatic: Gentlemen said, 'Duke Mu of Qin broadened his territory and increased his state, subjugated the strong Jin in the east, became hegemon over the Rong and Yi in the west, yet he did not become the alliance leader of the feudal lords—it was fitting.'

sentences.zh: 死而棄民，收其良臣而從死。

translations.literal: He died and abandoned the people, taking their good ministers to follow him in death.

sentences.zh: 且先王崩，尚猶遺德垂法，況奪之善人良臣百姓所哀者乎？

translations.literal: Moreover former kings collapsed, still left virtue hung laws, moreover took good people good ministers common people mourned ones?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, when former kings collapsed, they still left behind virtue and hanging laws—how much more so taking good people and good ministers whom the common people mourned?'

sentences.zh: 是以知秦不能復東征也。」

translations.literal: This is why know Qin cannot again east campaign.'
translations.idiomatic: This is why we know Qin cannot campaign east again.'

sentences.zh: 繆公子四十人，其太子嵤代立，是為康公。

translations.literal: Duke Mu had forty sons. His crown prince Gong replaced him on the throne—this was Duke Kang.

In the thirty-seventh year, Qin used You Yu's plan to attack the Rong king. They increased their states by twelve and opened up a thousand li of land. They then became hegemon of the Western Rong. The Son of Heaven sent Shao Gong Guo to congratulate Mu Gong with gold drums. In the thirty-ninth year, Mu Gong died. He was buried at Yong. There were one hundred seventy-seven followers in death. Three good ministers of Qin from the Zi Yu clan named Yanxi, Zhongxing, and Zhenhui were also among those who followed in death. The Qin people mourned them and made the song of the Yellow Bird poem. The gentlemen said: 'Duke Mu of Qin broadened his lands and increased his state. He subjugated strong Jin in the east and became hegemon of the Rong and Yi in the west. Yet he did not become the alliance leader of the feudal lords. This was also fitting. He died and abandoned his people, taking their good ministers to follow him in death. Moreover, when former kings passed away, they still left virtue and established laws. How much more so should we not take the good people and worthy ministers whom the common people mourned?' This is why we know Qin cannot campaign east again.' Mu Gong had forty sons. His crown prince Gong succeeded him. He was Kang Gong.

sentences.zh: 康公元年。

translations.literal: The first year of Duke Kang.

sentences.zh: 往歲繆公之卒，晉襄公亦卒；

translations.literal: Previous year Mu Gong died, Jin Xiang Gong also died;
translations.idiomatic: The previous year Duke Mu died, and Duke Xiang of Jin also died;

sentences.zh: 襄公之弟名雍，秦出也，在秦。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang's younger brother was named Yong, born of a Qin mother, and was in Qin.

sentences.zh: 晉趙盾欲立之，使隨會來迎雍，秦以兵送至令狐。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun of Jin wished to establish Yong and had Sui Hui come to welcome him. Qin sent troops to escort him as far as Linghu.

sentences.zh: 晉立襄公子而反擊秦師，秦師敗，隨會來奔。

translations.literal: Jin established Duke Xiang's son instead and attacked the Qin troops in return. The Qin troops were defeated, and Sui Hui came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 二年，秦伐晉，取武城，報令狐之役。

translations.literal: In the second year, Qin attacked Jin, took Wucheng, to repay the Linghu campaign.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉伐秦，取少梁。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Jin attacked Qin and took Shaoliang.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦伐晉，取羈馬。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Qin attacked Jin and took Jima.

sentences.zh: 戰於河曲，大敗晉軍。

translations.literal: They fought at Hequ and greatly defeated the Jin army.

sentences.zh: 晉人患隨會在秦為亂，乃使魏讎餘詳反，合謀會，詐而得會，會遂歸晉。

translations.literal: The Jin people worried that Sui Hui in Qin would cause chaos, so they had Wei Chouyu feign defection, unite in plotting with Hui, deceive and capture Hui, and Hui then returned to Jin.

sentences.zh: 康公立十二年卒，子共公立。

translations.literal: Duke Kang ruled for twelve years and died; his son Duke Gong took the throne.

In Kang Gong's first year. In the previous year when Mu Gong died, Duke Xiang of Jin also died; Xiang Gong's younger brother named Yong was born of Qin and was in Qin. Zhao Dun of Jin wished to establish him and sent Sui Hui to welcome Yong. Qin sent troops to escort him to Linghu. Jin established Xiang Gong's son instead and attacked the Qin troops. The Qin troops were defeated. Sui Hui fled to Qin. In the second year, Qin attacked Jin and took Wucheng, to repay the Linghu campaign. In the fourth year, Jin attacked Qin and took Shaoliang. In the sixth year, Qin attacked Jin and took Jima. They fought at Hequ and greatly defeated the Jin army. The Jin people worried that Sui Hui in Qin would cause chaos, so they had Wei Chouyu feign defection. They united to plot against Hui, deceived and got him. Hui then returned to Jin. Kang Gong was established for twelve years and died. His son Gong Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 共公二年，晉趙穿弒其君靈公。

translations.literal: In Duke Gong's second year, Zhao Chuan of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 三年，楚莊王彊，北兵至雒，問周鼎。

translations.literal: In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu grew strong, marched his troops north to Luo, and inquired about the Zhou ding.

sentences.zh: 共公立五年卒，子桓公立。

translations.literal: Duke Gong ruled for five years and died; his son Duke Huan took the throne.

In Gong Gong's second year, Zhao Chuan of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Ling. In the third year, King Zhuang of Chu was strong. He sent troops north to Luo and asked about the Zhou ding. Gong Gong was established for five years and died. His son Huan Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 桓公三年，晉敗我一將。

translations.literal: In Duke Huan's third year, Jin defeated one of our generals.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚莊王服鄭，北敗晉兵於河上。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu subjugated Zheng and marched north to defeat Jin troops on the river.

sentences.zh: 當是之時，楚霸，為會盟合諸侯。

translations.literal: At this time, Chu was hegemon and held assemblies and alliances to unite the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉厲公初立，與秦桓公夾河而盟。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Li of Jin was newly established and allied with Duke Huan of Qin across the river.

sentences.zh: 歸而秦倍盟，與翟合謀擊晉。

translations.literal: Upon returning, Qin doubled the alliance and united with the Di in plotting to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，晉率諸侯伐秦，秦軍敗走，追至涇而還。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Jin led the feudal lords to attack Qin. The Qin army was defeated and fled; they pursued them to the Jing and returned.

sentences.zh: 桓公立二十七年卒，子景公立。

translations.literal: Duke Huan ruled for twenty-seven years and died; his son Duke Jing took the throne.

In Huan Gong's third year, Jin defeated one of our generals. In the tenth year, King Zhuang of Chu subjugated Zheng and defeated Jin troops north at the river. At this time, Chu was hegemon and assembled and allied the feudal lords. In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Li of Jin was initially established and allied with Duke Huan of Qin across the river. Upon returning, Qin broke the alliance and united with the Di to plot against Jin. In the twenty-sixth year, Jin led the feudal lords to attack Qin. The Qin army was defeated and fled. They pursued to the Jing and returned. Huan Gong was established for twenty-seven years and died. His son Jing Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 景公四年，晉欒書弒其君厲公。

translations.literal: In Duke Jing's fourth year, Luan Shu of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 十五年，救鄭，敗晉兵於櫟。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, they rescued Zheng and defeated Jin troops at Yue.

sentences.zh: 是時晉悼公為盟主。

translations.literal: At this time, Duke Dao of Jin was the alliance leader.

sentences.zh: 十八年，晉悼公彊，數會諸侯，率以伐秦，敗秦軍。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Duke Dao of Jin grew strong, frequently assembled the feudal lords, and led them to attack Qin, defeating the Qin army.

sentences.zh: 秦軍走，晉兵追之，遂渡涇，至棫林而還。

translations.literal: The Qin army fled, and the Jin troops pursued them, then crossed the Jing, reached Yulin, and returned.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，景公如晉，與平公盟，已而背之。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Jing went to Jin and allied with Duke Ping, but then broke the alliance.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，楚公子圍弒其君而自立，是為靈王。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Prince Wei of Chu assassinated his ruler and established himself on the throne—this was King Ling.

sentences.zh: 景公母弟後子鍼有寵，景公母弟富，或譖之，恐誅，乃奔晉，車重千乘。

translations.literal: Duke Jing's mother's younger brother Hou Zi Zhen was favored. Duke Jing's mother's younger brother was rich. Someone slandered him; fearing execution, he fled to Jin with a thousand chariots and heavy baggage.

sentences.zh: 晉平公曰：「后子富如此，何以自亡？」

translations.literal: Jin Ping Gong said: 'Hou Zi rich like this, why self perish?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping of Jin said, 'Hou Zi is rich like this—why would he perish himself?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「秦公無道，畏誅，欲待其後世乃歸。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Qin Gong without way, feared execution, wished wait his later generations then return.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, 'The Duke of Qin is without the Way. I fear execution and wish to wait for his later generations before returning.'

sentences.zh: 三十九年，楚靈王彊，會諸侯於申，為盟主，殺齊慶封。

translations.literal: In the thirty-ninth year, King Ling of Chu grew strong, assembled the feudal lords at Shen, became the alliance leader, and killed Qing Feng of Qi.

sentences.zh: 景公立四十年卒，子哀公立。

translations.literal: Duke Jing ruled for forty years and died; his son Duke Ai took the throne.

sentences.zh: 后子復來歸秦。

translations.literal: Hou Zi came back and returned to Qin.

In Jing Gong's fourth year, Luan Shu of Jin assassinated their ruler Duke Li. In the fifteenth year, they rescued Zheng and defeated Jin troops at Yue. At this time, Duke Dao of Jin was the alliance leader. In the eighteenth year, Duke Dao of Jin was strong. He assembled the feudal lords several times and led them to attack Qin, defeating the Qin army. The Qin army fled. The Jin troops pursued them, then crossed the Jing, reached Yulin, and returned. In the twenty-seventh year, Jing Gong went to Jin and allied with Duke Ping, then broke the alliance. In the thirty-sixth year, Gong Zi Wei of Chu assassinated their ruler and established himself. He was King Ling. Jing Gong's younger maternal brother Hou Zi Zhen was favored. Jing Gong's younger maternal brother was rich. Someone slandered him. Fearing execution, he fled to Jin with a thousand chariots and heavy baggage. Duke Ping of Jin said: 'Hou Zi is rich like this. Why would he destroy himself?' He replied: 'The Qin ruler has no way. I fear execution. I wish to wait for his later generations then return.' In the thirty-ninth year, King Ling of Chu was strong. He assembled the feudal lords at Shen, became alliance leader, and killed Qing Feng of Qi. Jing Gong was established for forty years and died. His son Ai Gong was established. Hou Zi again came back to Qin.

sentences.zh: 哀公八年，楚公子棄疾弒靈王而自立，是為平王。

translations.literal: In Duke Ai's eighth year, Prince Qi Ji of Chu assassinated King Ling and established himself on the throne—this was King Ping.

sentences.zh: 十一年，楚平王來求秦女為太子建妻。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, King Ping of Chu came and requested a Qin woman to be the wife of Crown Prince Jian.

sentences.zh: 至國，女好而自娶之。

translations.literal: Upon arriving in the state, the woman was beautiful and he married her himself.

sentences.zh: 十五年，楚平王欲誅建，建亡；

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Chu Ping Wang wished execute Jian, Jian fled;
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, King Ping of Chu wished to execute Jian, and Jian fled;

sentences.zh: 伍子胥奔吳。

translations.literal: Wu Zixu fled to Wu.

sentences.zh: 晉公室卑而六卿彊，欲內相攻，是以久秦晉不相攻。

translations.literal: The Jin ducal house was weak while the six ministers were strong, and they wished to attack each other internally, which is why Qin and Jin did not attack each other for a long time.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，吳王闔閭與伍子胥伐楚，楚王亡奔隨，吳遂入郢。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, King Helü of Wu, together with Wu Zixu, attacked Chu. The Chu king fled and went to Sui, and Wu then entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 楚大夫申包胥來告急，七日不食，日夜哭泣。

translations.literal: The Chu grand master Shen Bao Xu came to report the urgency, going seven days without eating, weeping and crying day and night.

sentences.zh: 於是秦乃發五百乘救楚，敗吳師。

translations.literal: Thus Qin then sent five hundred chariots to rescue Chu and defeated the Wu troops.

sentences.zh: 吳師歸，楚昭王乃得復入郢。

translations.literal: The Wu troops returned, and King Zhao of Chu was then able to re-enter Ying.

sentences.zh: 哀公立三十六年卒。

translations.literal: Duke Ai ruled for thirty-six years and died.

sentences.zh: 太子夷公，夷公蚤死，不得立，立夷公子，是為惠公。

translations.literal: The crown prince was Yi Gong. Yi Gong died early and did not get established. They established Yi Gong's son—this was Duke Hui.

In Ai Gong's eighth year, Gong Zi Qi Ji of Chu assassinated King Ling and established himself. He was King Ping. In the eleventh year, King Ping of Chu came to request a Qin woman as wife for Crown Prince Jian. When he arrived in the state, the woman was beautiful and he married her himself. In the fifteenth year, King Ping of Chu wished to execute Jian. Jian fled; Wu Zi Xu fled to Wu. The Jin ducal house was weak and the six ministers were strong. They wished to attack each other internally. This is why Qin and Jin long did not attack each other. In the thirty-first year, King He Lu of Wu with Wu Zi Xu attacked Chu. The Chu king fled to Sui. Wu then entered Ying. The Chu grand master Shen Bao Xu came to report the urgency. He did not eat for seven days and wept day and night. Thus Qin then sent five hundred chariots to rescue Chu and defeated the Wu troops. The Wu troops returned. King Zhao of Chu then was able to re-enter Ying. Ai Gong was established for thirty-six years and died. The crown prince was Yi Gong. Yi Gong died early and could not be established. They established Yi Gong's son. He was Hui Gong.

sentences.zh: 惠公元年，孔子行魯相事。

translations.literal: In Duke Hui's first year, Confucius carried out the affairs of chancellor of Lu.

sentences.zh: 五年，晉卿中行、范氏反晉，晉使智氏、趙簡子攻之，范、中行氏亡奔齊。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, the Jin ministers Zhong Xing and the Fan clan rebelled against Jin. Jin had the Zhi clan and Zhao Jian Zi attack them, and the Fan and Zhong Xing clans fled and went to Qi.

sentences.zh: 惠公立十年卒，子悼公立。

translations.literal: Duke Hui ruled for ten years and died; his son Duke Dao took the throne.

In Hui Gong's first year, Confucius carried out the chancellor's affairs in Lu. In the fifth year, the Jin ministers Zhong Xing and Fan clans rebelled against Jin. Jin had the Zhi clan and Zhao Jian Zi attack them. The Fan and Zhong Xing clans fled to Qi. Hui Gong was established for ten years and died. His son Dao Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 悼公二年，齊臣田乞弒其君孺子，立其兄陽生，是為悼公。

translations.literal: In Duke Dao's second year, the Qi minister Tian Qi assassinated their ruler Ruzi and established his brother Yang Sheng—this was Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 六年，吳敗齊師。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Wu defeated the Qi troops.

sentences.zh: 齊人弒悼公，立其子簡公。

translations.literal: The Qi people assassinated Duke Dao and established his son Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 九年，晉定公與吳王夫差盟，爭長於黃池，卒先吳。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Duke Ding of Jin allied with King Fuchai of Wu, contended for seniority at Huangchi, and finally yielded to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳彊，陵中國。

translations.literal: Wu was strong and overawed the central states.

sentences.zh: 十二年，齊田常弒簡公，立其弟平公，常相之。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Tian Chang of Qi assassinated Duke Jian and established his brother Duke Ping, with Chang becoming chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十三年，楚滅陳。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Chu extinguished Chen.

sentences.zh: 秦悼公立十四年卒，子厲共公立。

translations.literal: Duke Dao of Qin ruled for fourteen years and died; his son Duke Li Gong took the throne.

sentences.zh: 孔子以悼公十二年卒。

translations.literal: Confucius died in Duke Dao's twelfth year.

In Dao Gong's second year, the Qi minister Tian Qi assassinated their ruler Ru Zi and established his brother Yang Sheng. He was Duke Dao. In the sixth year, Wu defeated the Qi troops. The Qi people assassinated Duke Dao and established his son Duke Jian. In the ninth year, Duke Ding of Jin allied with King Fu Chai of Wu. They contended for seniority at Huangchi, and finally yielded to Wu. Wu was strong and overawed the central states. In the twelfth year, Tian Chang of Qi assassinated Duke Jian and established his brother Duke Ping. Chang became chancellor. In the thirteenth year, Chu extinguished Chen. Qin Dao Gong was established for fourteen years and died. His son Duke Li Gong was established. Confucius died in Dao Gong's twelfth year.

sentences.zh: 厲共公二年，蜀人來賂。

translations.literal: In Duke Li Gong's second year, the Shu people came with bribes.

sentences.zh: 十六年，塹河旁。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, they moated along the river side.

sentences.zh: 以兵二萬伐大荔，取其王城。

translations.literal: They attacked Dali with twenty thousand troops and took its king city.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，初縣頻陽。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, they initially made Pinyang a county.

sentences.zh: 晉取武成。

translations.literal: Jin took Wucheng.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉亂，殺智伯，分其國與趙、韓、魏。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, there was chaos in Jin. They killed Zhi Bo and divided his state among Zhao, Han, and Wei.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，智開與邑人來奔。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Zhi Kai and the town people came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，伐義渠，虜其王。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, they attacked Yiqu and captured their king.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，日食。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 厲共公卒，子躁公立。

translations.literal: Duke Li Gong died, and his son Duke Zao took the throne.

In Duke Li Gong's second year, the Shu people came with bribes. In the sixteenth year, they built moats along the river. They attacked Dali with twenty thousand troops and took its royal city. In the twenty-first year, they initially made Pinyang a county. Jin took Wucheng. In the twenty-fourth year, Jin had chaos. They killed Zhi Bo and divided his state among Zhao, Han, and Wei. In the twenty-fifth year, Zhi Kai came fleeing with the town people. In the thirty-third year, they attacked Yiqu and captured their king. In the thirty-fourth year, there was a solar eclipse. Duke Li Gong died. His son Duke Zao was established.

sentences.zh: 躁公二年，南鄭反。

translations.literal: In Duke Zao's second year, Nanzheng rebelled.

sentences.zh: 十三年，義渠來伐，至渭南。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Yiqu came to attack and reached south of the Wei.

sentences.zh: 十四年，躁公卒，立其弟懷公。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Duke Zao died, and they established his younger brother Duke Huai.

In Zao Gong's second year, Nanzheng rebelled. In the thirteenth year, Yiqu came to attack and reached south of the Wei. In the fourteenth year, Zao Gong died. They established his younger brother Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷公四年，庶長朝與大臣圍懷公，懷公自殺。

translations.literal: In Duke Huai's fourth year, Shu Zhang Zhao and the grand ministers surrounded Duke Huai, and Duke Huai committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 懷公太子曰昭子，蚤死，大臣乃立太子昭子之子，是為靈公。

translations.literal: Duke Huai's crown prince was called Zhao Zi. He died early, so the grand ministers then established Crown Prince Zhao Zi's son—this was Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 靈公，懷公孫也。

translations.literal: Duke Ling was Duke Huai's grandson.

In Huai Gong's fourth year, Shu Zhang Zhao and the grand ministers surrounded Huai Gong. Huai Gong committed suicide. Huai Gong's crown prince was called Zhao Zi. He died early. The grand ministers then established Zhao Zi's son. He was Ling Gong. Ling Gong was Huai Gong's grandson.

sentences.zh: 靈公六年，晉城少梁，秦擊之。

translations.literal: In Duke Ling's sixth year, Jin walled Shaoliang, and Qin struck it.

sentences.zh: 十三年，城籍姑。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, they walled Jigu.

sentences.zh: 靈公卒，子獻公不得立，立靈公季父悼子，是為簡公。

translations.literal: Duke Ling died, and his son Duke Xian did not get established. They established Duke Ling's youngest uncle Dao Zi—this was Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 簡公，昭子之弟而懷公子也。

translations.literal: Duke Jian was Zhao Zi's younger brother and Duke Huai's son.

In Ling Gong's sixth year, Jin walled Shaoliang. Qin struck it. In the thirteenth year, they walled Jigu. Ling Gong died. His son Xian Gong could not be established. They established Ling Gong's younger uncle Dao Zi. He was Jian Gong. Jian Gong was Zhao Zi's younger brother and Huai Gong's son.

sentences.zh: 簡公六年，令吏初帶劍。

translations.literal: In Duke Jian's sixth year, he commanded officials to initially wear swords.

sentences.zh: 塹洛。

translations.literal: They moated Luo.

sentences.zh: 城重泉。

translations.literal: They walled Chongquan.

sentences.zh: 十六年卒，子惠公立。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, he died, and his son Duke Hui took the throne.
In Jian Gong's sixth year, he commanded officials to initially wear swords. They built moats at Luo. They walled Chongquan. In the sixteenth year, he died. His son Hui Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 惠公十二年，子出子生。

translations.literal: In Duke Hui's twelfth year, his son Chu Zi was born.

sentences.zh: 十三年，伐蜀，取南鄭。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, they attacked Shu and took Nanzheng.

sentences.zh: 惠公卒，出子立。

translations.literal: Duke Hui died, and Chu Zi took the throne.
In Hui Gong's twelfth year, his son Chu Zi was born. In the thirteenth year, they attacked Shu and took Nanzheng. Hui Gong died. Chu Zi was established.

sentences.zh: 出子二年，庶長改迎靈公之子獻公于河西而立之。

translations.literal: In Chu Zi's second year, Shu Zhang Gai welcomed Duke Ling's son Duke Xian from west of the river and established him on the throne.

sentences.zh: 殺出子及其母，沈之淵旁。

translations.literal: They killed Chu Zi and his mother, sinking them beside the abyss.

sentences.zh: 秦以往者數易君，君臣乖亂，故晉復彊，奪秦河西地。

translations.literal: Qin had frequently changed rulers in the past, with ruler and minister in discordant chaos, so Jin grew strong again and took Qin's lands west of the river.

In Chu Zi's second year, Shu Zhang Gai welcomed Ling Gong's son Xian Gong from west of the river and established him. They killed Chu Zi and his mother and sank them beside the abyss. Qin in the past frequently changed rulers. Ruler and minister were discordant and chaotic. Therefore Jin became strong again and took Qin's land west of the river.

sentences.zh: 獻公元年，止從死。

translations.literal: In Duke Xian's first year, they stopped the practice of following in death.

sentences.zh: 二年，城櫟陽。

translations.literal: In the second year, they walled Yueyang.

sentences.zh: 四年正月庚寅，孝公生。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, first month, Gengyin day, Duke Xiao was born.

sentences.zh: 十一年，周太史儋見獻公曰：「周故與秦國合而別，別五百歲復合，合（七）十七歲而霸王出。」

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Zhou grand scribe Dan saw Xian Gong said: 'Zhou formerly with Qin state united and separated, separated five hundred years then united, united seventeen years and hegemon king emerges.'
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, the Zhou grand scribe Dan saw Duke Xian and said, 'Zhou formerly united with the Qin state and then separated. Separated for five hundred years, they will unite again. United for seventeen years, and a hegemon king will emerge.'

sentences.zh: 十六年，桃冬花。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, peach trees flowered in winter.

sentences.zh: 十八年，雨金櫟陽。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, gold rained in Yueyang.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，與晉戰於石門，斬首六萬，天子賀以黼黻。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, they fought with Jin at Shimen, beheading sixty thousand. The Son of Heaven congratulated them with fu fu.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，與魏晉戰少梁，虜其將公孫痤。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, they fought with Wei Jin at Shaoliang and captured their general Gongsun Kuo.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，獻公卒，子孝公立，年已二十一歲矣。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Xian died, and his son Duke Xiao took the throne. He was already twenty-one years old.

In Xian Gong's first year, they stopped the practice of following in death. In the second year, they walled Yueyang. In the fourth year, first month, Gengyin day, Xiao Gong was born. In the eleventh year, Zhou's grand scribe Dan saw Xian Gong and said: 'Zhou formerly united with Qin state and then separated. Separated for five hundred years then united. United for seventeen years and a hegemon king will emerge.' In the sixteenth year, peaches flowered in winter. In the eighteenth year, it rained gold at Yueyang. In the twenty-first year, they fought with Jin at Shimen and beheaded sixty thousand. The Son of Heaven congratulated them with fufu robes. In the twenty-third year, they fought with Wei and Jin at Shaoliang and captured their general Gong Sun Kuo. In the twenty-fourth year, Xian Gong died. His son Xiao Gong was established. He was already twenty-one years old.

sentences.zh: 孝公元年，河山以東彊國六，與齊威、楚宣、魏惠、燕悼、韓哀、趙成侯并。

translations.literal: In Duke Xiao's first year, there were six strong states east of the river and mountains, equal with Qi Wei, Chu Xuan, Wei Hui, Yan Dao, Han Ai, and Zhao Cheng Hou.

sentences.zh: 淮泗之閒小國十餘。

translations.literal: Between the Huai and Si rivers were more than ten small states.

sentences.zh: 楚、魏與秦接界。

translations.literal: Chu and Wei adjoined borders with Qin.

sentences.zh: 魏筑長城，自鄭濱洛以北，有上郡。

translations.literal: Wei built the long wall, from Zheng along the Luo northward, and had Shang commandery.

sentences.zh: 楚自漢中，南有巴、黔中。

translations.literal: Chu, from Hanzhong southward, had Ba and Qianzhong.

sentences.zh: 周室微，諸侯力政，爭相併。

translations.literal: The Zhou house was weak, the feudal lords governed by force, and contended to annex each other.

sentences.zh: 秦僻在雍州，不與中國諸侯之會盟，夷翟遇之。

translations.literal: Qin was remote in Yong province, did not participate in the assemblies and alliances of the central states' feudal lords, and was treated as Yi and Di.

sentences.zh: 孝公於是布惠，振孤寡，招戰士，明功賞。

translations.literal: Duke Xiao thus spread favors, aided orphans and widows, recruited warriors, and clarified merit and rewards.

sentences.zh: 下令國中曰：「昔我繆公自岐雍之閒，修德行武，東平晉亂，以河為界，西霸戎翟，廣地千里，天子致伯，諸侯畢賀，為後世開業，甚光美。

translations.literal: Issued order in state said: 'Formerly our Mu Gong from Qi Yong between, cultivated virtue practiced martial, east pacified Jin chaos, with river as boundary, west hegemoned Rong Di, broadened land thousand li, Son of Heaven conferred Bo, feudal lords all congratulated, opened enterprise for later generations, very glorious beautiful.
translations.idiomatic: He issued an order in the state, saying, 'Formerly our Duke Mu, from between Qi and Yong, cultivated virtue and practiced martial affairs. In the east he pacified Jin's chaos, taking the river as boundary. In the west he became hegemon over the Rong and Di, broadening the land by a thousand li. The Son of Heaven conferred the title of Bo, and all the feudal lords congratulated him. He opened enterprises for later generations—very glorious and beautiful.'

sentences.zh: 會往者厲、躁、簡公、出子之不寧，國家內憂，未遑外事，三晉攻奪我先君河西地，諸侯卑秦、醜莫大焉。

translations.literal: They encountered the previous unrest of Dukes Li, Zao, Jian, and Chu Zi. The state had internal worries and no leisure for external affairs. The three Jin attacked and seized our former rulers' lands west of the river. The feudal lords belittled Qin—there was no greater shame.'

sentences.zh: 獻公即位，鎮撫邊境，徙治櫟陽，且欲東伐，復繆公之故地，修繆公之政令。

translations.literal: Duke Xian ascended the throne, pacified and stabilized the borders, moved the capital to Yueyang, and wished to attack eastward to recover Duke Mu's former lands and repair Duke Mu's government orders.

sentences.zh: 寡人思念先君之意，常痛於心。

translations.literal: I think of the former rulers' intentions and am constantly pained in my heart.'

sentences.zh: 賓客群臣有能出奇計彊秦者，吾且尊官，與之分土。」

translations.literal: Guests ministers able produce extraordinary plans strengthen Qin, I moreover honor office, with him divide land.'
translations.idiomatic: Guests and ministers who can produce extraordinary plans to strengthen Qin—I will moreover honor their office and divide land with them.'

sentences.zh: 於是乃出兵東圍陜城，西斬戎之獂王。

translations.literal: Thus he then sent troops to surround Xia city in the east and behead the Rong king Lian in the west.

In Xiao Gong's first year, east of the rivers and mountains there were six strong states, equal to Qi Wei, Chu Xuan, Wei Hui, Yan Dao, Han Ai, and Zhao Cheng Hou. Between the Huai and Si there were over ten small states. Chu and Wei adjoined borders with Qin. Wei built the long wall, from Zheng along the Luo to the north, and had Shang commandery. Chu from Hanzhong south had Ba and Qianzhong. The Zhou house was weak. The feudal lords governed by force and contended to annex each other. Qin was remote in Yong province and did not participate in the assemblies and alliances of the central states' feudal lords. The Yi and Di treated it as such. Xiao Gong thus spread favors, aided orphans and widows, recruited warriors, and clarified merit and rewards. He issued an order in the state saying: 'Formerly our Mu Gong from between Qi and Yong cultivated virtue and practiced martial affairs. He pacified Jin chaos in the east with the river as boundary. He hegemoned the Rong and Di in the west and broadened the land by a thousand li. The Son of Heaven conferred the title of Bo. All the feudal lords congratulated him. He opened the enterprise for later generations. It was very glorious and beautiful. Encountering the unrest of the previous Li, Zao, Jian Gong, and Chu Zi, the state had internal worries and no leisure for external affairs. The three Jin attacked and seized our former rulers' land west of the river. The feudal lords belittled Qin. There was no greater shame. Xian Gong ascended the throne, pacified and stabilized the borders, moved the capital to Yueyang, and wished to attack east to recover Mu Gong's former land and repair Mu Gong's government orders. I think of the former rulers' intentions and am constantly pained in my heart. Any guest or minister who can produce extraordinary plans to strengthen Qin, I will moreover honor his office and divide land with him.' Thus he then sent troops to surround Xia city in the east and beheaded the Rong's Lian Wang in the west.

sentences.zh: 衛鞅聞是令下，西入秦，因景監求見孝公。

translations.literal: Wei Yang heard this order issued, entered Qin from the west, and through Jing Jian sought to see Duke Xiao.
Wei Yang heard this order issued and went west into Qin. Through Jing Jian he sought to see Duke Xiao.

sentences.zh: 二年，天子致胙。

translations.literal: In the second year, the Son of Heaven sent zhou.
In the second year, the Son of Heaven sent zhou.

sentences.zh: 三年，衛鞅說孝公變法修刑，內務耕稼，外勸戰死之賞罰，孝公善之。

translations.literal: In the third year, Wei Yang persuaded Duke Xiao to change the laws and repair the punishments, internally to attend to farming, externally to encourage rewards and punishments for battle and death. Duke Xiao approved it.

sentences.zh: 甘龍、杜摯等弗然，相與爭之。

translations.literal: Gan Long, Du Zhi, and others did not approve and contended with him about it.

sentences.zh: 卒用鞅法，百姓苦之；

translations.literal: Finally used Yang laws, common people suffered it;
translations.idiomatic: They finally used Yang's laws, and the common people suffered from them;

sentences.zh: 居三年，百姓便之。

translations.literal: After three years, the common people found it convenient.

sentences.zh: 乃拜鞅為左庶長。

translations.literal: He then appointed Yang as Left Shu Zhang.

sentences.zh: 其事在商君語中。

translations.literal: Its affairs are among the words of the Shang Jun.

In the third year, Wei Yang persuaded Duke Xiao to change the laws and repair the punishments: internally attend to farming, externally encourage rewards and punishments for battle and death. Duke Xiao approved it. Gan Long, Du Zhi, and others did not approve and mutually contended against it. They finally used Yang's laws. The common people suffered from them; After three years, the common people found it convenient. He then appointed Yang as Left Shu Zhang. Its affairs are among the words of the Shang Jun.

sentences.zh: 七年，與魏惠王會杜平。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he met with King Hui of Wei at Duping.

sentences.zh: 八年，與魏戰元裏，有功。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, he fought with Wei at Yuanli and achieved merit.

sentences.zh: 十年，衛鞅為大良造，將兵圍魏安邑，降之。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Wei Yang became Da Liang Zao, led troops to surround Wei's Anyi, and it surrendered.

sentences.zh: 十二年，作為咸陽，筑冀闕，秦徙都之。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, he made Xianyang, built the Ji Que, and Qin moved its capital there.

sentences.zh: 并諸小鄉聚，集為大縣，縣一令，四十一縣。

translations.literal: He merged various small townships and gatherings, assembled them into large counties—each county with one ling, forty-one counties.

sentences.zh: 為田開阡陌。

translations.literal: For the fields, he opened qian and mo.

sentences.zh: 東地渡洛。

translations.literal: The eastern lands crossed the Luo.

sentences.zh: 十四年，初為賦。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, he initially made fu.

sentences.zh: 十九年，天子致伯。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, the Son of Heaven conferred Bo.

sentences.zh: 二十年，諸侯畢賀。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, all the feudal lords congratulated.

sentences.zh: 秦使公子少官率師會諸侯逢澤，朝天子。

translations.literal: Qin had Prince Shao Guan lead troops to assemble the feudal lords at Fengze and court the Son of Heaven.

In the seventh year, he met with King Hui of Wei at Du Ping. In the eighth year, he fought with Wei at Yuan Li and had merit. In the tenth year, Wei Yang became Da Liang Zao. He led troops and surrounded Wei's Anyi, causing it to surrender. In the twelfth year, he made Xianyang, built the Ji Que, and Qin moved its capital there. He merged the various small townships and gatherings into large counties, each county with one ling, making forty-one counties. For the fields he opened the qian and mo. The eastern lands crossed the Luo. In the fourteenth year, they initially made fu. In the nineteenth year, the Son of Heaven conferred the title of Bo. In the twentieth year, all the feudal lords congratulated. Qin had Gong Zi Shao Guan lead troops to assemble the feudal lords at Feng Ze and court the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，齊敗魏馬陵。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Qi defeated Wei at Ma Ling.
In the twenty-first year, Qi defeated Wei at Ma Ling.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，衛鞅擊魏，虜魏公子卬。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Wei Yang attacked Wei and captured Prince Ang of Wei.

sentences.zh: 封鞅為列侯，號商君。

translations.literal: He enfeoffed Yang as a Lie Hou and titled him Shang Jun.
In the twenty-second year, Wei Yang struck Wei and captured Gong Zi Ang of Wei. He enfeoffed Yang as Lie Hou, titled him Shang Jun.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與晉戰雁門，虜其將魏錯。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, he fought with Jin at Yanmen and captured their general Wei Cuo.
In the twenty-fourth year, he fought with Jin at Yan Men and captured their general Wei Cuo.

sentences.zh: 孝公卒，子惠文君立。

translations.literal: Duke Xiao died, and his son Lord Huiwen took the throne.

sentences.zh: 是歲，誅衛鞅。

translations.literal: This year, they executed Wei Yang.

sentences.zh: 鞅之初為秦施法，法不行，太子犯禁。

translations.literal: When Yang initially implemented laws for Qin, the laws were not carried out, and the crown prince violated the prohibitions.

sentences.zh: 鞅曰：「法之不行，自於貴戚。

translations.literal: Yang said: 'Laws not carried out, from noble relatives.
translations.idiomatic: Yang said, 'The laws not being carried out comes from the noble relatives.'

sentences.zh: 君必欲行法，先於太子。

translations.literal: If the ruler must carry out the laws, begin with the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子不可黥，黥其傅師。」

translations.literal: Crown prince cannot qing, qing his fu shi.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince cannot be qinged, so qing his fu shi.'

sentences.zh: 於是法大用，秦人治。

translations.literal: Thus the laws were greatly used, and the Qin people were governed.

sentences.zh: 及孝公卒，太子立，宗室多怨鞅，鞅亡，因以為反，而卒車裂以徇秦國。

translations.literal: When Duke Xiao died and the crown prince took the throne, the clan members greatly resented Yang. Yang fled, and they therefore considered it rebellion, and finally he was cart-torn to warn the Qin state.

Duke Xiao died. His son Lord Hui Wen was established. This year, they executed Wei Yang. When Yang initially implemented laws for Qin, the laws were not carried out. The crown prince violated the prohibitions. Yang said: 'The laws are not carried out because of the noble relatives. If you, ruler, must want to carry out the laws, start with the crown prince. The crown prince cannot be qinged. Qing his fu shi.' Thus the laws were greatly used. The Qin people were governed. When Duke Xiao died and the crown prince was established, the clan members greatly resented Yang. Yang fled. They therefore considered it rebellion and finally cart-tore him to warn the Qin state.

sentences.zh: 惠文君元年，楚、韓、趙、蜀人來朝。

translations.literal: In the first year of Lord Huiwen, people of Chu, Han, Zhao, and Shu came to court.

sentences.zh: 二年，天子賀。

translations.literal: In the second year, the Son of Heaven congratulated.

sentences.zh: 三年，王冠。

translations.literal: In the third year, the king was crowned.

sentences.zh: 四年，天子致文武胙。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, the Son of Heaven sent wen wu zhou.

sentences.zh: 齊、魏為王。

translations.literal: Qi and Wei became kings.

In Lord Hui Wen's first year, the people of Chu, Han, Zhao, and Shu came to court. In the second year, the Son of Heaven congratulated. In the third year, the king was crowned. In the fourth year, the Son of Heaven sent wen wu zhou. Qi and Wei became kings.

sentences.zh: 五年，陰晉人犀首為大良造。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Xi Shou of Yinjin became Da Liang Zao.

sentences.zh: 六年，魏納陰晉，陰晉更名寧秦。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Wei accepted Yinjin, and Yinjin changed its name to Ningqin.

sentences.zh: 七年，公子卬與魏戰，虜其將龍賈，斬首八萬。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Prince Ang fought with Wei, captured their general Long Jia, and beheaded eighty thousand.

sentences.zh: 八年，魏納河西地。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Wei ceded the lands west of the river.

sentences.zh: 九年，渡河，取汾陰、皮氏。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, they crossed the river and took Fenyin and Pishi.

sentences.zh: 與魏王會應。

translations.literal: He met with the King of Wei at Ying.

sentences.zh: 圍焦，降之。

translations.literal: They surrounded Jiao, and it surrendered.

sentences.zh: 十年，張儀相秦。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Zhang Yi became chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 魏納上郡十五縣。

translations.literal: Wei ceded fifteen counties of Shang commandery.

sentences.zh: 十一年，縣義渠。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, they made Yiqu a county.

sentences.zh: 歸魏焦、曲沃。

translations.literal: They returned Jiao and Quwo to Wei.

sentences.zh: 義渠君為臣。

translations.literal: The ruler of Yiqu became a minister.

sentences.zh: 更名少梁曰夏陽。

translations.literal: They changed the name of Shaoliang to Xiayang.

sentences.zh: 十二年，初臘。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, they initially performed the la sacrifice.

sentences.zh: 十三年四月戊午，魏君為王，韓亦為王。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, fourth month, Wuwu day, the Wei ruler became king, and Han also became king.

sentences.zh: 使張儀伐取陜，出其人與魏。

translations.literal: They had Zhang Yi attack and take Xia, and moved its people to give to Wei.

In the fifth year, the man from Yinjin Xi Shou became Da Liang Zao. In the sixth year, Wei accepted Yinjin. Yinjin changed its name to Ningqin. In the seventh year, Gong Zi Ang fought with Wei, captured their general Long Jia, and beheaded eighty thousand. In the eighth year, Wei ceded the land west of the river. In the ninth year, they crossed the river and took Fenying and Pishi. They met with the Wei king at Ying. They surrounded Jiao and it surrendered. In the tenth year, Zhang Yi became chancellor of Qin. Wei ceded fifteen counties of Shang commandery. In the eleventh year, they made Yiqu a county. They returned Jiao and Quwo to Wei. The Yi Qu ruler became a minister. They changed the name of Shaoliang to Xiayang. In the twelfth year, they initially performed the la sacrifice. In the thirteenth year, fourth month, Wuwu day, the Wei ruler became king. Han also became king. They had Zhang Yi attack and take Xia, then moved its people and gave them to Wei.

sentences.zh: 十四年，更為元年。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, they changed it to the first year.

sentences.zh: 二年，張儀與齊、楚大臣會齧桑。

translations.literal: In the second year, Zhang Yi met with Qi and Chu ministers at Niesang.

sentences.zh: 三年，韓、魏太子來朝。

translations.literal: In the third year, the crown princes of Han and Wei came to court.

sentences.zh: 張儀相魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi became chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 五年，王游至北河。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, the king toured to the north river.

sentences.zh: 七年，樂池相秦。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Le Chi became chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 韓、趙、魏、燕、齊帥匈奴共攻秦。

translations.literal: Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, and Qi led the Xiongnu in a joint attack on Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦使庶長疾與戰修魚，虜其將申差，敗趙公子渴、韓太子奐，斬首八萬二千。

translations.literal: Qin had Shu Zhang Ji fight them at Xiuyu, captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Prince Ke of Zhao and Crown Prince Huan of Han, and beheaded eighty-two thousand.

sentences.zh: 八年，張儀復相秦。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Zhang Yi once again became chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 九年，司馬錯伐蜀，滅之。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Sima Cuo attacked Shu and destroyed it.

sentences.zh: 伐取趙中都、西陽十年，韓太子蒼來質。

translations.literal: They attacked and took Zhongdu and Xiyang of Zhao. In the tenth year, Crown Prince Cang of Han came as hostage.

sentences.zh: 伐取韓石章。

translations.literal: They attacked and took Shizhang of Han.

sentences.zh: 伐敗趙將泥。

translations.literal: They attacked and defeated the Zhao general Ni.

sentences.zh: 伐取義渠二十五城。

translations.literal: They attacked and took twenty-five cities of Yiqu.

sentences.zh: 十一年，摢裏疾攻魏焦，降之。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Mang Li Ji attacked Jiao of Wei, and it surrendered.

sentences.zh: 敗韓岸門，斬首萬，其將犀首走。

translations.literal: They defeated Han at Anmen, beheaded ten thousand, and their general Xi Shou fled.

sentences.zh: 公子通封於蜀。

translations.literal: Prince Tong was enfeoffed in Shu.

sentences.zh: 燕君讓其臣子之。

translations.literal: The ruler of Yan yielded his minister Zi Zhi to Qin.

sentences.zh: 十二年，王與梁王會臨晉。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, the king met with the King of Liang at Linjin.

sentences.zh: 庶長疾攻趙，虜趙將莊。

translations.literal: Shu Zhang Ji attacked Zhao and captured their general Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 張儀相楚。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi became chancellor of Chu.

sentences.zh: 十三年，庶長章擊楚於丹陽，虜其將屈丐，斬首八萬；

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Shu Zhang Zhang struck Chu at Dan Yang, captured their general Qu Gai, beheaded eighty thousand;
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Shu Zhang Zhang attacked Chu at Danyang, captured their general Qu Gai, and beheaded eighty thousand;

sentences.zh: 又攻楚漢中，取地六百里，置漢中郡。

translations.literal: He again attacked Chu's Hanzhong, took six hundred li of land, and established Hanzhong commandery.

sentences.zh: 楚圍雍氏，秦使庶長疾助韓而東攻齊，到滿助魏攻燕。

translations.literal: Chu surrounded Yongshi. Qin had Shu Zhang Ji assist Han while attacking Qi to the east, and Dao Man assist Wei in attacking Yan.

sentences.zh: 十四年，伐楚，取召陵。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, they attacked Chu and took Zhaoling.

sentences.zh: 丹、犁臣，蜀相壯殺蜀侯來降。

translations.literal: Dan and Li became ministers. Shu's chancellor Zhuang killed the Marquis of Shu and came to surrender.

In the fourteenth year, they changed it to the first year. In the second year, Zhang Yi met with Qi and Chu ministers at Niesang. In the third year, the crown princes of Han and Wei came to court. Zhang Yi became chancellor of Wei. In the fifth year, the king toured to the northern river. In the seventh year, Le Chi became chancellor of Qin. Han, Zhao, Wei, Yan, and Qi led the Xiongnu and together attacked Qin. Qin had Shu Zhang Ji fight them at Xiuyu, captured their general Shen Chai, defeated Zhao's Gong Zi Ke and Han's crown prince Huan, and beheaded eighty-two thousand. In the eighth year, Zhang Yi again became chancellor of Qin. In the ninth year, Sima Cuo attacked Shu and extinguished it. They attacked and took Zhao's Zhongdu and Xiyang. In the tenth year, Han's crown prince Cang came as hostage. They attacked and took Han's Shizhang. They attacked and defeated Zhao's general Ni. They attacked and took twenty-five cities of Yiqu. In the eleventh year, Mang Li Ji attacked Wei's Jiao and it surrendered. They defeated Han at Anmen, beheaded ten thousand, and their general Xi Shou fled. Gong Zi Tong was enfeoffed in Shu. The Yan ruler yielded his minister Zi Zhi. In the twelfth year, the king met with the Liang king at Linjin. Shu Zhang Ji attacked Zhao and captured Zhao's general Zhuang. Zhang Yi became chancellor of Chu. In the thirteenth year, Shu Zhang Zhang struck Chu at Danyang, captured their general Qu Gai, and beheaded eighty thousand; They again attacked Chu's Hanzhong, took six hundred li of land, and established Hanzhong commandery. Chu surrounded Yongshi. Qin had Shu Zhang Ji assist Han and attack Qi to the east, and Dao Man assist Wei in attacking Yan. In the fourteenth year, they attacked Chu and took Zhaoling. Dan and Li became ministers. Shu's chancellor Zhuang killed the Shu hou and came to surrender.

sentences.zh: 惠王卒，子武王立。

translations.literal: King Hui died, and his son King Wu took the throne.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏、齊、楚、越皆賓從。

translations.literal: Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, and Yue all came as guests in submission.
King Hui died. His son King Wu was established. Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, and Yue all followed as guests.

sentences.zh: 武王元年，與魏惠王會臨晉。

translations.literal: In the first year of King Wu, he met with King Hui of Wei at Linjin.

sentences.zh: 誅蜀相壯。

translations.literal: They executed Shu's chancellor Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 張儀、魏章皆東出之魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang both went east to Wei.

sentences.zh: 伐義渠、丹、犁。

translations.literal: They attacked Yiqu, Dan, and Li.

sentences.zh: 二年，初置丞相，摢裏疾、甘茂為左右丞相。

translations.literal: In the second year, they initially established the position of chancellor, with Mang Li Ji and Gan Mao serving as left and right chancellors.

sentences.zh: 張儀死於魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi passed away in Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，與韓襄王會臨晉外。

translations.literal: In the third year, he met with King Xiang of Han outside Linjin.

sentences.zh: 南公揭卒，摢裏疾相韓。

translations.literal: Nan Gong Jie died, and Mang Li Ji became chancellor of Han.

sentences.zh: 武王謂甘茂曰：「寡人欲容車通三川，窺周室，死不恨矣。」

translations.literal: Wu Wang told Gan Mao said: 'I wish broad chariot pass San Chuan, peep Zhou room, die not regret.'
translations.idiomatic: King Wu said to Gan Mao, 'I wish to drive my broad chariot through the Three Rivers region and glimpse the Zhou royal domain. I would die without regret.'

sentences.zh: 其秋，使甘茂、庶長封伐宜陽。

translations.literal: That autumn, he had Gan Mao and Shu Zhang Feng attack Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 四年，拔宜陽，斬首六萬。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, they captured Yiyang and beheaded sixty thousand.

sentences.zh: 涉河，城武遂。

translations.literal: They crossed the river and walled Wusui.

sentences.zh: 魏太子來朝。

translations.literal: The crown prince of Wei came to court.

sentences.zh: 武王有力好戲，力士任鄙、烏獲、孟說皆至大官。

translations.literal: King Wu was strong and enjoyed feats of strength. The strongmen Ren Bi, Wu Huo, and Meng Shuo all reached high office.

sentences.zh: 王與孟說舉鼎，絕臏。

translations.literal: The king competed with Meng Shuo in lifting a ding tripod, and broke his kneecap.

sentences.zh: 八月，武王死。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, King Wu died.

sentences.zh: 族孟說。

translations.literal: They exterminated Meng Shuo's clan.

sentences.zh: 武王取魏女為后，無子。

translations.literal: King Wu had taken a woman of Wei as his queen, but she bore no sons.

sentences.zh: 立異母弟，是為昭襄王。

translations.literal: They established his younger half-brother, who became King Zhaoxiang.

sentences.zh: 昭襄母楚人，姓羋氏，號宣太后。

translations.literal: King Zhaoxiang's mother was a Chu native of the Mi clan, titled Xuan Taihou.

sentences.zh: 武王死時，昭襄王為質於燕，燕人送歸，得立。

translations.literal: When King Wu died, King Zhaoxiang was a hostage in Yan. The Yan people sent him back, and he was able to take the throne.

In King Wu's first year, he met with King Hui of Wei at Linjin. They executed Shu's chancellor Zhuang. Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang all went east to Wei. They attacked Yiqu, Dan, and Li. In the second year, they initially established the chancellor position, with Mang Li Ji and Gan Mao as left and right chancellors. Zhang Yi died in Wei. In the third year, he met with King Xiang of Han outside Linjin. Nan Gong Jie died. Mang Li Ji became chancellor of Han. King Wu told Gan Mao: 'I wish to have broad chariots pass through Sanchuan and peep at the Zhou chamber. I would die without regret.' That autumn, he had Gan Mao and Shu Zhang Feng attack Yiyang. In the fourth year, they pulled Yiyang and beheaded sixty thousand. They crossed the river and walled Wusui. The Wei crown prince came to court. King Wu had strength and liked play. The strong men Ren Bi, Wu Huo, and Meng Shuo all reached great official positions. The king lifted a ding with Meng Shuo and broke his kneecap. In the eighth month, King Wu died. They clanned Meng Shuo. King Wu took a Wei woman as queen. She had no sons. They established his different mother younger brother. He was King Zhao Xiang. King Zhao Xiang's mother was a Chu person of the Mi clan, titled Xuan Taihou. When King Wu died, King Zhao Xiang was a hostage in Yan. The Yan people sent him back and he got established.

sentences.zh: 昭襄王元年，嚴君疾為相。

translations.literal: In the first year of King Zhaoxiang, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 甘茂出之魏。

translations.literal: Gan Mao departed for Wei.

sentences.zh: 二年，彗星見。

translations.literal: In the second year, a comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 庶長壯與大臣、諸侯、公子為逆，皆誅，及惠文后皆不得良死。

translations.literal: Shu Zhang Zhuang conspired with high ministers, feudal lords, and princes in rebellion. They were all executed, as was Queen Huiwen, none meeting a good end.

sentences.zh: 悼武王后出歸魏。

translations.literal: The Queen Dowager Dao of King Wu went out and returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，王冠。

translations.literal: In the third year, the king was crowned.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會黃棘，與楚上庸。

translations.literal: He met with the King of Chu at Huangji and ceded Shangyong to Chu.

sentences.zh: 四年，取蒲阪。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, they took Puban.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 五年，魏王來朝應亭，復與魏蒲阪。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, the King of Wei came to court at Yingteng, and they again gave Puban to Wei.

sentences.zh: 六年，蜀侯煇反，司馬錯定蜀。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, the Marquis of Shu rebelled, and Sima Cuo pacified Shu.

sentences.zh: 庶長奐伐楚，斬首二萬。

translations.literal: Shu Zhang Huan attacked Chu and beheaded twenty thousand.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君質於齊。

translations.literal: Lord Jingyang became a hostage in Qi.

sentences.zh: 日食，晝晦。

translations.literal: There was a solar eclipse, and the day grew dark.

sentences.zh: 七年，拔新城。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, they captured Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 摢裏子卒。

translations.literal: Mang Li Zi passed away.

sentences.zh: 八年，使將軍羋戎攻楚，取新市。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, they sent General Mi Rong to attack Chu and take Xinshi.

sentences.zh: 齊使章子，魏使公孫喜，韓使暴鳶共攻楚方城，取唐眛。

translations.literal: Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gongsun Xi, and Han sent Bao Yuan. Together they attacked Chu's Fangcheng and took Tangmian.

sentences.zh: 趙破中山，其君亡，竟死齊。

translations.literal: Zhao destroyed Zhongshan. Its ruler fled and eventually died in Qi.

sentences.zh: 魏公子勁、韓公子長為諸侯。

translations.literal: Prince Jing of Wei and Prince Chang of Han became feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 九年，孟嘗君薛文來相秦。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Lord Mengchang Xue Wen came to serve as chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 奐攻楚，取八城，殺其將景快。

translations.literal: Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, and killed their general Jing Kuai.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚懷王入朝秦，秦留之。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, King Huai of Chu came to Qin to pay court, and Qin detained him.

sentences.zh: 薛文以金受免。

translations.literal: Xue Wen was dismissed through bribery with gold.

sentences.zh: 樓緩為丞相。

translations.literal: Lou Huan became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊、韓、魏、趙、宋、中山五國共攻秦，至鹽氏而還。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, and Zhongshan-five states together attacked Qin, reached Yanshi, and returned.

sentences.zh: 秦與韓、魏河北及封陵以和。

translations.literal: Qin made peace with Han and Wei, giving them the lands north of the Yellow River and Fengling.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王走之趙，趙不受，還之秦，即死，歸葬。

translations.literal: King Huai of Chu fled to Zhao, but Zhao would not accept him. They returned him to Qin, where he immediately died, and his body was returned for burial.

sentences.zh: 十二年，樓緩免，穰侯魏冉為相。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Lou Huan was dismissed, and Lord Ranghou Wei Ran became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 予楚粟五萬石。

translations.literal: They gave Chu fifty thousand shi of grain.

In King Zhao Xiang's first year, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor. Gan Mao went out to Wei. In the second year, a comet was seen. Shu Zhang Zhuang rebelled with grand ministers, feudal lords, and gong zi. They were all executed, and Queen Hui Wen also did not get a good death. Queen Dao Wu Wang went out and returned to Wei. In the third year, the king was crowned. He met with the Chu king at Huangji and ceded Shangyong to Chu. In the fourth year, they took Puban. A comet was seen. In the fifth year, the Wei king came to court at Yingting. They again gave Puban to Wei. In the sixth year, Shu hou Hui rebelled. Sima Cuo pacified Shu. Shu Zhang Huan attacked Chu and beheaded twenty thousand. Lord Jingyang was a hostage in Qi. There was a solar eclipse. The day was dark. In the seventh year, they pulled Xincheng. Mang Li Zi died. In the eighth year, they had General Mi Rong attack Chu and take Xinshi. Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gong Sun Xi, Han sent Bao Yuan. They together attacked Chu's Fangcheng and took Tangmian. Zhao broke Zhongshan. Its ruler fled and finally died in Qi. Wei Gong Zi Jing and Han Gong Zi Chang became feudal lords. In the ninth year, Meng Chang Jun Xue Wen came to be chancellor of Qin. Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, and killed their general Jing Kuai. In the tenth year, Chu's King Huai entered to court Qin. Qin detained him. Xue Wen was dismissed through bribery with gold. Lou Huan became chancellor. In the eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, and Zhongshan - five states together attacked Qin. They reached Yanshi and returned. Qin made peace with Han and Wei by giving them the land north of the Yellow River and Fengling. A comet was seen. Chu's King Huai fled to Zhao. Zhao did not accept him. They returned him to Qin, where he immediately died. His body was returned for burial. In the twelfth year, Lou Huan was dismissed. Rang Hou Wei Ran became chancellor. They gave Chu fifty thousand shi of grain.

sentences.zh: 十三年，向壽伐韓，取武始。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han and took Wushi.

sentences.zh: 左更白起攻新城。

translations.literal: Left Minister Bai Qi attacked Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 五大夫禮出亡奔魏。

translations.literal: The Five Great Officers Li went into exile and fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 任鄙為漢中守。

translations.literal: Ren Bi became governor of Hanzhong.

sentences.zh: 十四年，左更白起攻韓、魏於伊闕，斬首二十四萬，虜公孫喜，拔五城。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Left Minister Bai Qi attacked Han and Wei at Yique, beheaded two hundred forty thousand, captured Gongsun Xi, and took five cities.

sentences.zh: 十五年，大良造白起攻魏，取垣，復予之。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Grand Commandant Bai Qi attacked Wei, took Yuan, and then gave it back.

sentences.zh: 攻楚，取宛。

translations.literal: He attacked Chu and took Wan.

sentences.zh: 十六年，左更錯取軹及鄧。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Left Minister Cuo took Zhi and Deng.

sentences.zh: 冉免，封公子市宛，公子悝鄧，魏冉陶，為諸侯。

translations.literal: Ran was dismissed. Prince Shi was enfeoffed at Wan, Prince Kui at Deng, and Wei Ran at Tao, becoming feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十七年，城陽君入朝，及東周君來朝。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, Lord Chengyang entered to pay court, and Lord Dongzhou came to pay court.

sentences.zh: 秦以垣為蒲阪、皮氏。

translations.literal: Qin changed Yuan to Puban and Pishi.

sentences.zh: 王之宜陽。

translations.literal: The king went to Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 十八年，錯攻垣、河雍，決橋取之。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan and Heyong, broke the bridge, and took them.

sentences.zh: 十九年，王為西帝，齊為東帝，皆復去之。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, the king became Western Emperor and Qi became Eastern Emperor, but they both soon abandoned these titles.

sentences.zh: 呂禮來自歸。

translations.literal: Lu Li came and surrendered of his own accord.

sentences.zh: 齊破宋，宋王在魏，死溫。

translations.literal: Qi destroyed Song. The King of Song was in Wei and died at Wen.

sentences.zh: 任鄙卒。

translations.literal: Ren Bi passed away.

sentences.zh: 二十年，王之漢中，又之上郡、北河。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, the king went to Hanzhong, and then again to Shang commandery and the northern river regions.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，錯攻魏河內。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei's Henan region.

sentences.zh: 魏獻安邑，秦出其人，募徙河東賜爵，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: Wei offered Anyi. Qin expelled its people, recruited settlers to Hedong and granted them nobility ranks, and pardoned criminals to move them there.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君封宛。

translations.literal: Lord Jingyang was enfeoffed at Wan.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，蒙武伐齊。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 河東為九縣。

translations.literal: Hedong was divided into nine counties.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會宛。

translations.literal: He met with the King of Chu at Wan.

sentences.zh: 與趙王會中陽。

translations.literal: He met with the King of Zhao at Zhongyang.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，尉斯離與三晉、燕伐齊，破之濟西。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Wei Si Li with the Three Jin states and Yan attacked Qi and defeated them west of the Ji River.

sentences.zh: 王與魏王會宜陽，與韓王會新城。

translations.literal: The king met with the King of Wei at Yiyang, and with the King of Han at Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與楚王會鄢，又會穰。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the King of Chu at Yan, and again at Rang.

sentences.zh: 秦取魏安城，至大梁，燕、趙救之，秦軍去。

translations.literal: Qin took Wei's Ancheng and reached Daliang. Yan and Zhao came to rescue it, and the Qin army withdrew.

sentences.zh: 魏冉免相。

translations.literal: Wei Ran was dismissed as chancellor.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，拔趙二城。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, they captured two cities of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 與韓王會新城，與魏王會新明邑。

translations.literal: He met with the King of Han at Xincheng, and with the King of Wei at Xinmingyi.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，赦罪人遷之穰。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, they pardoned criminals and moved them to Rang.

sentences.zh: 侯冉復相。

translations.literal: Hou Ran again became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，錯攻楚。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 赦罪人遷之南陽。
