translations.literal: They pardoned criminals and moved them to Nanyang.

sentences.zh: 白起攻趙，取代光狼城。

translations.literal: Bai Qi attacked Zhao and took the city of Guanglang in Dai.

sentences.zh: 又使司馬錯發隴西，因蜀攻楚黔中，拔之。

translations.literal: They again sent Sima Cuo to mobilize troops from Longxi, following the route through Shu to attack Chu's Qianzhong, and captured it.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，大良造白起攻楚，取鄢、鄧，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Grand Commandant Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Yan and Deng, and moved pardoned criminals to live there.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，大良造白起攻楚，取郢為南郡，楚王走。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Grand Commandant Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Ying and made it Nan commandery. The King of Chu fled.

sentences.zh: 周君來。

translations.literal: The Lord of Zhou came.

sentences.zh: 王與楚王會襄陵。

translations.literal: The king met with the King of Chu at Xiangling.

sentences.zh: 白起為武安君。

translations.literal: Bai Qi was titled Lord Wuan.

sentences.zh: 三十年，蜀守若伐楚，取巫郡，及江南為黔中郡。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, Shu's governor Ruo attacked Chu, took Wu commandery, and made Jiangnan into Qianzhong commandery.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，白起伐魏，取兩城。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei and took two cities.

sentences.zh: 楚人反我江南。

translations.literal: The people of Chu rebelled in our Jiangnan region.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，相穰侯攻魏，至大梁，破暴鳶，斬首四萬，鳶走，魏入三縣請和。

translations.literal: In the thirty-second year, Chancellor Lord Rang attacked Wei, reached Daliang, defeated Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand. Yuan fled, and Wei ceded three counties to sue for peace.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，客卿胡（傷）［陽］攻魏卷、蔡陽、長社，取之。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Guest Minister Hu Yang attacked Wei's Juan, Caiyang, and Changshe, and took them.

sentences.zh: 擊芒卯華陽，破之，斬首十五萬。

translations.literal: He attacked Mangmao and Huayang, defeated them, and beheaded one hundred fifty thousand.

sentences.zh: 魏入南陽以和。

translations.literal: Wei ceded Nanyang to make peace.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，秦與魏、韓上庸地為一郡，南陽免臣遷居之。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, Qin combined the Shangyong lands of Wei and Han into one commandery. Freed ministers from Nanyang were moved to live there.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，佐韓、魏、楚伐燕。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Qin assisted Han, Wei, and Chu in attacking Yan.

sentences.zh: 初置南陽郡。

translations.literal: Nanyang commandery was initially established.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，客卿灶攻齊，取剛、壽，予穰侯。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Guest Minister Zao attacked Qi, took Gang and Shou, and gave them to Lord Rang.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，中更胡（傷）［陽］攻趙閼與，不能取。

translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, Central Minister Hu Yang attacked Zhao's Eyu but could not take it.

sentences.zh: 四十年，悼太子死魏，歸葬芷陽。

translations.literal: In the fortieth year, Crown Prince Dao died in Wei and was returned for burial at Zhiyang.

sentences.zh: 四十一年夏，攻魏，取邢丘、懷。

translations.literal: In the summer of the forty-first year, Qin attacked Wei and took Xingqiu and Huai.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，安國君為太子。

translations.literal: In the forty-second year, Lord Anguo became crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十月，宣太后薨，葬芷陽酈山。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, Empress Dowager Xuan died and was buried at Zhiyang's Li Mountain.

sentences.zh: 九月，穰侯出之陶。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, Lord Rang went out to Tao.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，武安君白起攻韓，拔九城，斬首五萬。

translations.literal: In the forty-third year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi attacked Han, captured nine cities, and beheaded fifty thousand.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，攻韓南（郡）［陽］，取之。

translations.literal: In the forty-fourth year, Qin attacked Han's Nanyang and took it.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，五大夫賁攻韓，取十城。

translations.literal: In the forty-fifth year, the Five Great Officers Ben attacked Han and took ten cities.

sentences.zh: 葉陽君悝出之國，未至而死。

translations.literal: Lord Yeyang Kui went out of the country but died before arriving.

sentences.zh: 四十七年，秦攻韓上黨，上黨降趙，秦因攻趙，趙發兵擊秦，相距。

translations.literal: In the forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han's Shangdang. Shangdang surrendered to Zhao, so Qin attacked Zhao. Zhao sent troops to strike Qin, and they confronted each other.

sentences.zh: 秦使武安君白起擊，大破趙於長平，四十餘萬盡殺之。

translations.literal: Qin sent Lord Wuan Bai Qi to strike. He greatly defeated Zhao at Changping and killed all forty-plus myriads of them.

sentences.zh: 四十八年十月，韓獻垣雍。

translations.literal: In the tenth month of the forty-eighth year, Han offered Yuanyong.

sentences.zh: 秦軍分為三軍。

translations.literal: The Qin army was divided into three armies.

sentences.zh: 武安君歸。

translations.literal: Lord Wuan returned.

sentences.zh: 王龁將伐趙（武安）皮牢，拔之。

translations.literal: Wang He led the attack on Zhao's Pilao and captured it.

sentences.zh: 司馬梗北定太原，盡有韓上黨。

translations.literal: Sima Geng pacified Taiyuan to the north and completely controlled Han's Shangdang.

sentences.zh: 正月，兵罷，復守上黨。

translations.literal: In the first month, the troops were withdrawn and Shangdang was garrisoned again.

sentences.zh: 其十月，五大夫陵攻趙邯鄲。

translations.literal: In that tenth month, the Five Great Officers Ling attacked Zhao's Handan.

sentences.zh: 四十九年正月，益發卒佐陵。

translations.literal: In the first month of the forty-ninth year, additional troops were sent to assist Ling.

sentences.zh: 陵戰不善，免，王龁代將。

translations.literal: Ling fought poorly and was dismissed. Wang He replaced him as general.

sentences.zh: 其十月，將軍張唐攻魏，為蔡尉捐弗守，還斬之。

translations.literal: In that tenth month, General Zhang Tang attacked Wei. Because Cai's Commandant Juan did not defend, he returned and beheaded him.

sentences.zh: 五十年十月，武安君白起有罪，為士伍，遷陰密。

translations.literal: In the tenth month of the fiftieth year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi was found guilty, demoted to common soldier, and moved to Yinmi.

sentences.zh: 張唐攻鄭，拔之。

translations.literal: Zhang Tang attacked Zheng and captured it.

sentences.zh: 十二月，益發卒軍汾城旁。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month, additional troops were sent to station beside Fencheng.

sentences.zh: 武安君白起有罪，死。

translations.literal: Lord Wuan Bai Qi was found guilty and died.

sentences.zh: 龁攻邯鄲，不拔，去，還奔汾軍。

translations.literal: He attacked Handan but could not capture it, so he withdrew and rushed back to the Fen army.

sentences.zh: 二月餘攻晉軍，斬首六千，晉楚流死河二萬人。

translations.literal: For more than two months they attacked the Jin army, beheaded six thousand, and twenty thousand of Jin and Chu drowned and died in the river.

sentences.zh: 攻汾城，即從唐拔寧新中，寧新中更名安陽。

translations.literal: They attacked Fencheng, then captured Ningxinzhong from Tang. Ningxinzhong was renamed Anyang.

sentences.zh: 初作河橋。

translations.literal: A bridge across the river was initially built.

In the thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han and took Wushi. Left More Bai Qi attacked Xincheng. The Five Great Men Li went out and fled to Wei. Ren Bi became the guard of Hanzhong. In the fourteenth year, Left More Bai Qi attacked Han and Wei at Yique, beheaded two hundred forty thousand, captured Gong Sun Xi, and pulled five cities. In the fifteenth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Wei, took Yuan, and again gave it back. They attacked Chu and took Wan. In the sixteenth year, Left More Cuo took Zhi and Deng. Ran was dismissed. Gong Zi Shi was enfeoffed at Wan, Gong Zi Kui at Deng, and Wei Ran at Tao. They became feudal lords. In the seventeenth year, Lord Chengyang entered to court, and Lord Dongzhou came to court. Qin changed Yuan to Puban and Pishi. The king went to Yiyang. In the eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan and Heyong, broke the bridge and took them. In the nineteenth year, the king became the Western Emperor and Qi became the Eastern Emperor. They all again abandoned these titles. Lu Li came and surrendered himself. Qi broke Song. The Song king was in Wei and died at Wen. Ren Bi died. In the twentieth year, the king went to Hanzhong, and again to Shang commandery and North River. In the twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei's Henei. Wei offered Anyi. Qin expelled its people, recruited migrants to Hedong and granted them nobility titles, and pardoned criminals to move them there. Lord Jingyang was enfeoffed at Wan. In the twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi. Hedong was made into nine counties. He met with the Chu king at Wan. He met with the Zhao king at Zhongyang. In the twenty-third year, Wei Si Li, together with the three Jin and Yan, attacked Qi and broke them west of the Ji. The king met with the Wei king at Yiyang and with the Han king at Xincheng. In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the Chu king at Yan and again at Rang. Qin took Wei's Ancheng and reached Daliang. Yan and Zhao rescued it, so the Qin army withdrew. Wei Ran was dismissed as chancellor. In the twenty-fifth year, they pulled two cities from Zhao. He met with the Han king at Xincheng and with the Wei king at Xinmingyi. In the twenty-sixth year, criminals were pardoned and moved to Rang. Hou Ran again became chancellor. In the twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu. Criminals were pardoned and moved to Nanyang. Bai Qi attacked Zhao and took Daiguanglang city. They again had Sima Cuo send troops from Longxi, following through Shu to attack Chu's Qianzhong, and pulled it. In the twenty-eighth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Yan and Deng, and pardoned criminals to move them there. In the twenty-ninth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Ying and made it Nanguo commandery. The Chu king fled. The Zhou jun came. The king met with the Chu king at Xiangling. Bai Qi became Lord Wuan. In the thirtieth year, Shu's guard Ruo attacked Chu, took Wujun, and Jiangnan as Qianzhong commandery. In the thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei and took two cities. The Chu people rebelled against our Jiangnan. In the thirty-second year, Chancellor Rang Hou attacked Wei and reached Daliang. He broke Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand. Yuan fled. Wei ceded three counties and pleaded for peace. In the thirty-third year, guest minister Hu Yang attacked Wei's Juan, Caiyang, and Changshe, and took them. They struck Mang Mao at Huayang, broke it, and beheaded one hundred fifty thousand. Wei ceded Nanyang to make peace. In the thirty-fourth year, Qin combined Shangyong land with Wei and Han into one commandery. Freed ministers from Nanyang were moved to live there. In the thirty-fifth year, they assisted Han, Wei, and Chu in attacking Yan. They initially established Nanyang commandery. In the thirty-sixth year, guest minister Zao attacked Qi, took Gang and Shou, and gave them to Rang Hou. In the thirty-eighth year, Middle More Hu Yang attacked Zhao's Eyu but could not take it. In the fortieth year, Crown Prince Dao died in Wei. He was returned and buried at Zhiyang. In summer of the forty-first year, they attacked Wei and took Xingqiu and Huai. In the forty-second year, Lord Anguo became crown prince. In the tenth month, Xuan Taihou died. She was buried at Lishan in Zhiyang. In the ninth month, Rang Hou went out to Tao. In the forty-third year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi attacked Han, pulled nine cities, and beheaded fifty thousand. In the forty-fourth year, they attacked Han's Nanyang and took it. In the forty-fifth year, the Five Great Men Ben attacked Han and took ten cities. Lord Yeyang Kui went out to the country. He died before arriving. In the forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han's Shangdang. Shangdang surrendered to Zhao. Qin therefore attacked Zhao. Zhao sent troops to strike Qin. They confronted each other. Qin had Lord Wuan Bai Qi strike. He greatly broke Zhao at Changping and killed all four hundred thousand. In the tenth month of the forty-eighth year, Han offered Yuanyong. The Qin army was divided into three armies. Lord Wuan returned. Wang He was to attack Zhao's Pilao and pull it. Sima Geng pacified Taiyuan to the north and completely took Han's Shangdang. In the first month, troops were dismissed. They again guarded Shangdang. In that tenth month, the Five Great Men Ling attacked Zhao's Handan. In the first month of the forty-ninth year, they additionally sent troops to assist Ling. Ling fought poorly and was dismissed. Wang He replaced him as general. In that tenth month, General Zhang Tang attacked Wei. Because Cai Wei Juan did not guard, he returned and beheaded him. In the tenth month of the fiftieth year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi had a crime. He was made a common soldier and moved to Yinmi. Zhang Tang attacked Zheng and pulled it. In the twelfth month, they additionally sent troops to station beside Fencheng. Lord Wuan Bai Qi had a crime and died. He attacked Handan but could not pull it. He went and returned to rush to the Fen army. For more than two months they attacked the Jin army, beheaded six thousand, and twenty thousand Jin and Chu people drowned and died in the river. They attacked Fencheng, then from Tang pulled Ningxinzhong. Ningxinzhong changed its name to Anyang. They initially made a river bridge.

sentences.zh: 五十一年，將軍摎攻韓，取陽城、負黍，斬首四萬。

translations.literal: In the fifty-first year, General Liu attacked Han, took Yangcheng and Fushu, and beheaded forty thousand.

sentences.zh: 攻趙，取二十餘縣，首虜九萬。

translations.literal: They attacked Zhao, took more than twenty counties, and captured ninety thousand heads.

sentences.zh: 西周君背秦，與諸侯約從，將天下銳兵出伊闕攻秦，令秦毋得通陽城。

translations.literal: The Lord of Western Zhou betrayed Qin, allied with the feudal lords, led the world's best troops out of Yique to attack Qin, and prevented Qin from connecting with Yangcheng.

sentences.zh: 於是秦使將軍摎攻西周。

translations.literal: Thereupon Qin sent General Liu to attack Western Zhou.

sentences.zh: 西周君走來自歸，頓首受罪，盡獻其邑三十六城，口三萬。

translations.literal: The Lord of Western Zhou fled and came to surrender of his own accord. He kowtowed and accepted punishment, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people.

sentences.zh: 秦王受獻，歸其君於周。

translations.literal: The King of Qin accepted the offering and returned the lord to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 五十二年，周民東亡，其器九鼎入秦。

translations.literal: In the fifty-second year, the Zhou people fled east, and their nine ding vessels entered Qin.

sentences.zh: 周初亡。

translations.literal: Zhou began to perish.

In the fifty-first year, General Liu attacked Han, took Yangcheng and Fushu, and beheaded forty thousand. They attacked Zhao, took more than twenty counties, and captured ninety thousand heads. The West Zhou jun betrayed Qin and allied with the feudal lords. He led the world's sharp troops out of Yique to attack Qin, making Qin unable to connect to Yangcheng. Thereupon Qin had General Liu attack West Zhou. The West Zhou jun fled and came to surrender himself. He knocked his head and received punishment, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people. The Qin king accepted the offering and returned his jun to Zhou. In the fifty-second year, the Zhou people fled east. Their vessels, the nine ding, entered Qin. Zhou initially perished.

sentences.zh: 五十三年，天下來賓。

translations.literal: In the fifty-third year, the world came as guests.

sentences.zh: 魏後，秦使摎伐魏，取吳城。

translations.literal: Later, Wei followed. Qin sent Liu to attack Wei and take Wucheng.

sentences.zh: 韓王入朝，魏委國聽令。

translations.literal: The King of Han entered to pay court, and Wei entrusted its state and obeyed commands.

sentences.zh: 五十四年，王郊見上帝於雍。

translations.literal: In the fifty-fourth year, the king performed the suburban sacrifice and saw the Supreme Deity at Yong.

sentences.zh: 五十六年秋，昭襄王卒，子孝文王立。

translations.literal: In the autumn of the fifty-sixth year, King Zhaoxiang died, and his son King Xiaowen took the throne.

sentences.zh: 尊唐八子為唐太后，而合其葬於先王。

translations.literal: They honored Tang Bazi as Empress Dowager Tang and combined her burial with the previous kings.

sentences.zh: 韓王衰绖入弔祠，諸侯皆使其將相來弔祠，視喪事。

translations.literal: The King of Han entered in mourning clothes to offer condolences and sacrifices. All the feudal lords sent their generals and chancellors to offer condolences and sacrifices, and to view the funeral affairs.

In the fifty-third year, the world came as guests. Later, Wei. Qin had Liu attack Wei and take Wucheng. The Han king entered to court. Wei entrusted its state and listened to commands. In the fifty-fourth year, the king in the suburbs saw Shangdi at Yong. In autumn of the fifty-sixth year, King Zhao Xiang died. His son King Xiao Wen was established. They honored Tang Ba Zi as Tang Taihou and combined her burial with the previous kings. The Han king in mourning clothes entered to offer condolences and sacrifices. All the feudal lords had their generals and chancellors come to offer condolences and sacrifices and view the funeral affairs.

sentences.zh: 孝文王元年，赦罪人，修先王功臣，褒厚親戚，弛苑囿。

translations.literal: In the first year of King Xiaowen, he pardoned criminals, honored the meritorious ministers of previous kings, praised and enriched his relatives, and relaxed restrictions on gardens and enclosures.

sentences.zh: 孝文王除喪，十月己亥即位，三日辛醜卒，子莊襄王立。

translations.literal: King Xiaowen ended mourning. In the tenth month, on Jihai day, he ascended the throne. Three days later, on Xinchou day, he died, and his son King Zhuangxiang took the throne.

In King Xiao Wen's first year, they pardoned criminals, repaired the previous king's merit ministers, praised and thickened relatives, and relaxed the gardens and enclosures. King Xiao Wen removed mourning. In the tenth month on Jihai day he ascended the throne. Three days later on Xinchou day he died. His son King Zhuang Xiang was established.

sentences.zh: 莊襄王元年，大赦罪人，修先王功臣，施德厚骨肉而布惠於民。

translations.literal: In the first year of King Zhuangxiang, he granted a great pardon to criminals, honored the meritorious ministers of previous kings, applied virtue to enrich his flesh and blood, and spread favor to the people.

sentences.zh: 東周君與諸侯謀秦，秦使相國呂不韋誅之，盡入其國。

translations.literal: The Lord of Eastern Zhou conspired with the feudal lords against Qin. Qin had Chancellor Lü Buwei execute him and completely took his state.

sentences.zh: 秦不絕其祀，以陽人地賜周君，奉其祭祀。

translations.literal: Qin did not cut off its sacrifices, granting the Lord of Zhou land at Yangren to carry out its sacrificial offerings.

sentences.zh: 使蒙驁伐韓，韓獻成皋、鞏。

translations.literal: He sent Meng Ao to attack Han, and Han offered Chenggao and Gong.

sentences.zh: 秦界至大梁，初置三川郡。

translations.literal: Qin's border reached Daliang, and Sanchuan commandery was initially established.

sentences.zh: 二年，使蒙驁攻趙，定太原。

translations.literal: In the second year, he sent Meng Ao to attack Zhao and pacify Taiyuan.

sentences.zh: 三年，蒙驁攻魏高都、汲，拔之。

translations.literal: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei's Gaodu and Ji, and captured them.

sentences.zh: 攻趙榆次、新城、狼孟，取三十七城。

translations.literal: He attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, and Langmeng, taking thirty-seven cities.

sentences.zh: 四月日食。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: （四年）王龁攻上黨。

translations.literal: (Fourth year) Wang He attacked Shang Dang.
translations.idiomatic: (In the fourth year) Wang He attacked Shangdang.

sentences.zh: 初置太原郡。

translations.literal: Taiyuan commandery was initially established.

sentences.zh: 魏將無忌率五國兵擊秦，秦卻於河外。

translations.literal: Wei general Wu Ji led troops from five states to attack Qin, and Qin retreated beyond the river.

sentences.zh: 蒙驁敗，解而去。

translations.literal: Meng Ao was defeated, disbanded his troops, and left.

sentences.zh: 五月丙午，莊襄王卒，子政立，是為秦始皇帝。

translations.literal: In the fifth month, on Bingwu day, King Zhuangxiang died. His son Zheng took the throne—this was Qin Shihuangdi.

In King Zhuang Xiang's first year, they greatly pardoned criminals, repaired the previous king's merit ministers, applied virtue to thicken bone and flesh, and spread favor to the people. The East Zhou jun plotted with the feudal lords against Qin. Qin had Chancellor Lu Buwei execute him and completely entered his state. Qin did not cut off its sacrifices. They granted Yangren land to the Zhou jun to carry out its sacrificial offerings. They had Meng Ao attack Han. Han offered Chenggao and Gong. Qin's border reached Daliang. They initially established Sanchuan commandery. In the second year, they had Meng Ao attack Zhao and pacify Taiyuan. In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei's Gaodu and Ji and pulled them. They attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, and Langmeng, and took thirty-seven cities. In the fourth month there was a solar eclipse. (In the fourth year) Wang He attacked Shangdang. They initially established Taiyuan commandery. Wei general Wu Ji led five states' troops to strike Qin. Qin retreated outside the river. Meng Ao was defeated and disbanded and went. In the fifth month on Bingwu day, King Zhuang Xiang died. His son Zheng was established. He was Qin Shi Huangdi.

sentences.zh: 秦王政立二十六年，初并天下為三十六郡，號為始皇帝。

translations.literal: King Zheng of Qin took the throne for twenty-six years. He initially united the world into thirty-six commanderies and was titled Shihuangdi.

sentences.zh: 始皇帝五十一年而崩，子胡亥立，是為二世皇帝。

translations.literal: Shihuangdi ruled for fifty-one years and then died. His son Huhai took the throne—this was Ershi Huangdi.

sentences.zh: 三年，諸侯并起叛秦，趙高殺二世，立子嬰。

translations.literal: In the third year, the feudal lords all rose in rebellion against Qin. Zhao Gao killed Ershi and established Ziying.

sentences.zh: 子嬰立月餘，諸侯誅之，遂滅秦。

translations.literal: Ziying ruled for more than a month. The feudal lords executed him and thus extinguished Qin.

sentences.zh: 其語在始皇本紀中。

translations.literal: The account is in the Basic Annals of Shihuangdi.

Qin King Zheng was established for twenty-six years. He initially united the world into thirty-six commanderies and was titled Shi Huangdi. Shi Huangdi collapsed after fifty-one years. His son Hu Hai was established. He was Er Shi Huangdi. In the third year, the feudal lords together rose and rebelled against Qin. Zhao Gao killed Er Shi and established Zi Ying. Zi Ying was established for more than a month. The feudal lords executed him and then extinguished Qin. Its words are in the Shi Huang Annals.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：秦之先為嬴姓。

translations.literal: Tai Shi Gong said: Qin's ancestor was Ying surname.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Qin's ancestor was of the Ying surname.

sentences.zh: 其後分封，以國為姓，有徐氏、郯氏、莒氏、終黎氏、運奄氏、菟裘氏、將梁氏、黃氏、江氏、修魚氏、白冥氏、蜚廉氏、秦氏。

translations.literal: His descendants were enfeoffed and took states as surnames: the Xu clan, Tan clan, Ju clan, Zhongli clan, Yunyan clan, Tuqiu clan, Jiangliang clan, Huang clan, Jiang clan, Xiuyu clan, Baiming clan, Feilian clan, and Qin clan.

sentences.zh: 然秦以其先造父封趙城，為趙氏。

translations.literal: However, Qin, with its ancestor Zaofu, was enfeoffed at Zhao city and became the Zhao clan.

The Grand Historian says: 'Qin's ancestor was of the Ying surname.' His descendants were enfeoffed and took their states as surnames. There were the Xu clan, Tan clan, Ju clan, Zhongli clan, Yunyan clan, Tuqiu clan, Jiangliang clan, Huang clan, Jiang clan, Xiuyu clan, Baiming clan, Feilian clan, and Qin clan. However, Qin took its ancestor Zaofu who was enfeoffed at Zhao city as the Zhao clan.
